commit_message:
Fix ironic port creation after Redfish inspection

Change non-existent ``eth_summary`` property to ``summary`` on
ethernet_interfaces resource of Sushy.

Also amended the helper method, ``create_ports_if_not_exist`` in
inspect_utils module to handle Sushy returned ethernet summary
results.

Change-Id: I59a3d269c3508cc1e86d0ad5af3707585b108fa0
Story: 2004638
Task: 28574

[{'created': '2019-01-09 12:10:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix updating nodes with removed or broken drivers

Currently when updating a node we try to acquire the lock on it using
its old database record, including its old driver. This is not correct
when updating a driver, since the current conductor may not have access

Since we do not need task.driver at all when updating nodes, this change

Change-Id: I510c3bfbd11b01fef05341be2bb04c6bd01bf8ac

commit_message:
Fix updating nodes with removed or broken drivers

Currently when updating a node we try to acquire the lock on it using
its old database record, including its old driver. This is not correct
when updating a driver, since the current conductor may not have access
to the old driver (and the old driver may no longer be enabled at all).

Since we do not need task.driver at all when updating nodes, this change
stops populating it in update_node.

Conflicts:
	ironic/conductor/task_manager.py

Change-Id: I510c3bfbd11b01fef05341be2bb04c6bd01bf8ac
Story: #2004741
Task: #28812
(cherry picked from commit cea8d74914db22cb8478d6382e281140dd071253)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 12:21:00.000000000', 'message': "Reno only - Check for available networks for a role

Since change: I07822ec0cba7eed352c0010eb893b5e5a522e95c
resources are no longer created for networks that are not
defined in roles data. While this is an improvement we
need to communicate this change.

There is tribal knowledge and documentation that failed
reflect the requirement to add networks to roles data
since the introduction of composable networks in Pike.

Prior to Pike adding a network to a role was achived by
overriding the resource_registry entry to not use the
noop.yaml fake port (fall back to ctlplane) template.
i.e to add External network to compute role the
following was commonly added to network-environment.yaml

  OS::TripleO::Compute::Ports::ExternalPort:
    ../network/ports/external.yaml

NOTE: Current OVN-DVR and ODL doc's downstream uses the
      resource_registry override, whitout also adding
      the network to roles data.

Related-Bug: #1800811
Change-Id: I6c03c7a2bd6f369bf35a9e479a97302c9a455197
"}]
commit_message:
Reno only - Check for available networks for a role

Since change: I07822ec0cba7eed352c0010eb893b5e5a522e95c
resources are no longer created for networks that are not
defined in roles data. While this is an improvement we
need to communicate this change.

There is tribal knowledge and documentation that failed
reflect the requirement to add networks to roles data
since the introduction of composable networks in Pike.

Prior to Pike adding a network to a role was achived by
overriding the resource_registry entry to not use the
noop.yaml fake port (fall back to ctlplane) template.
i.e to add External network to compute role the
following was commonly added to network-environment.yaml

  OS::TripleO::Compute::Ports::ExternalPort:
    ../network/ports/external.yaml

NOTE: Current OVN-DVR and ODL doc's downstream uses the
      resource_registry override, whitout also adding
      the network to roles data.

Related-Bug: #1800811
Change-Id: I6c03c7a2bd6f369bf35a9e479a97302c9a455197

Not all roles have all networks, when creating certificates
we need to filter out certificate specs where the hiera
lookup returns 'nil'.

Previously we created noop resources with fallback to the
ctlplane network for all networks defined in network data.
So the hiera lookup returned a hostname for all networks
no matter if the roles data included that network. This is
no longer the case, so we need to filter.

Bonus, we no longer create certificates that are'nt actually
used.

commit_message:
Filter apache_certificates_specs if hostname is empty

Not all roles have all networks, when creating certificates
we need to filter out certificate specs where the hiera
lookup returns 'nil'.

Previously we created noop resources with fallback to the
ctlplane network for all networks defined in network data.
So the hiera lookup returned a hostname for all networks
no matter if the roles data included that network. This is
no longer the case, so we need to filter.

Bonus, we no longer create certificates that are'nt actually
used.

Change-Id: I651919488cb68b0b9878b4e21ab376bfc6e3f0fe
Closes-Bug: #1811207

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-10 22:04:50.000000000', 'message': "remove dynamic ns.enable generators

The ns.enabled generators will fail when running packetbeat with a limit.
These generators were dynamically enabling/disabling packetbeat features
based on things discovered in the environment however they we're
attempting to be a little to fancy, especially when running packetbeat
in a non-osa cloud. The values for the services have been reset to the
provider defaults and should teh deployer want to configure these option
they can use config_template.

Change-Id: I36d7298ca5142e8b5f926ab5d59ab8283704b5af
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
"}]
commit_message:
remove dynamic ns.enable generators

The ns.enabled generators will fail when running packetbeat with a limit.
These generators were dynamically enabling/disabling packetbeat features
based on things discovered in the environment however they we're
attempting to be a little to fancy, especially when running packetbeat
in a non-osa cloud. The values for the services have been reset to the
provider defaults and should teh deployer want to configure these option
they can use config_template.

Change-Id: I36d7298ca5142e8b5f926ab5d59ab8283704b5af
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

(10 comments)

I've never been a fan of the server groups functionality. The -1 here is for the use of a scalar string "server_group" attribute in the HTTP response instead of using a list of group UUIDs, which IMHO is more future proof. There really isn't a reason that an instance must only ever be in a single server group, and codifying a 1:1 relationship between an instance and a server group in the API is a mistake.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-01-09 14:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-01-09 14:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

[{'created': '2018-11-02 21:24:30.000000000', 'message': "Enable configuration of Designate's pools.yaml

This is necessary as the settings in this file are deployment
specific, so the defaults will never be correct.  For simplicity,
the enablement environment includes the sample pools.yaml content
from the Designate docs.  It can then be easily modified to match
the actual intended deployment environment.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580524
Change-Id: I84cc3b06ac77c723994be0f49960a93e0dbba0ad
(cherry picked from commit e025ebc0c423aa7b83869de278808386cd3d2d52)
"}]
commit_message:
Enable configuration of Designate's pools.yaml

This is necessary as the settings in this file are deployment
specific, so the defaults will never be correct.  For simplicity,
the enablement environment includes the sample pools.yaml content
from the Designate docs.  It can then be easily modified to match
the actual intended deployment environment.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580524
Change-Id: I84cc3b06ac77c723994be0f49960a93e0dbba0ad
(cherry picked from commit e025ebc0c423aa7b83869de278808386cd3d2d52)

commit_message:
Add support to rewrite the flavor id in restore

When using karbor to restore server to another openstack
cluster(cross keystone), and if the another cluster do not
have the same flavor id, the restore will fail. We should
add support for adding flavor id as a parameter to rewrite
the flavor id in checkpoint metadata.

Change-Id: Ie5c7a1adf07b7f9b1225ee4a5e16000a3453a7cc
Closes-Bug: #1811090

messages:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-07-17 11:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-07-25 08:44:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Since we are now planning to take Stein to refine even further the base APIv2 while it is still experimental, maybe this should not be merged as we do not want to declare 2.00 yet?'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-07-25 11:43:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Since we are now planning to take Stein to refine even further the
 > base APIv2 while it is still experimental, maybe this should not be
 > merged as we do not want to declare 2.00 yet?

It makes sense. I don't feel confident to have apiv2 as stable just now. We better wait another cycle and do it properly"}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-07-25 11:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-07-26 07:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-01-09 17:22:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Does it need any more work at this point?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-01-09 17:24:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-09 17:36:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The patch itself is fine. The "real microversion mechanism" (what I mean is, something that actually allows the developer to write different codepaths for, as an example, 2.01 and 2.02) can still come later.

But I think the idea here is that we won't merge 581774 and 582282 until everything looks stable on the server-side: 623300 is a prerequisite, plus I intend to go through the API one more time and see if anything else needs polishing.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-01-09 17:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> The patch itself is fine. The "real microversion mechanism" (what I
 > mean is, something that actually allows the developer to write
 > different codepaths for, as an example, 2.01 and 2.02) can still
 > come later.

Do you mean that it can be added later without changing the API, or requiring a change of the API, thanks to the basic infrastructure set here?

 > But I think the idea here is that we won't merge 581774 and 582282
 > until everything looks stable on the server-side: 623300 is a
 > prerequisite, plus I intend to go through the API one more time and
 > see if anything else needs polishing.

Do you think we can make it before M2 (in two days)?'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-09 17:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The basic infrastructure here means that the API is already setup for users to consume microversions. The only changes needed "for the real thing" will be internal

(To describe these internal changes-- in the simplest case, an if-statement inside the view function could differentiate microversions; in a more complicated case, Sahara would adopt the logic seen in other services which dynamically registers view functions based on given microversion)'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-09 17:55:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It's entirely possible to make it before M2."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-09 18:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

oh, I guess story 2002178 should be added to the commit message too'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-10 14:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-10 14:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-10 16:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-10 18:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-01-10 18:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2019-01-10 18:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2019-01-10 21:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Give the illusion of microversion support

Understand and react to microversions in accordance with
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/microversion_specification.html

The actual mechanism allowing for new microversions of APIv2 will come
later.

Story: 2002178
Task: 20044

Change-Id: I2b664189e45ac4ffd02c3a176787b4bfb78b3871

commit_message:
Add CentOS NetworkManager testing node

This enables NetworkManager control of interfaces on a new centos7-nm
node type.  This is intended only for short-term initial testing.

Change-Id: I43318f33d206c28e1f06ac7a8f07c3fb8c8f0626

commit_message:
Make nova-manage capable of syncing all cell databases

The 'nova-manage db sync' command can't sync all cell databases.
We propose to add --all-cells option to this command.

This patch implements syncing the databases of all the cells.

Co-Authored-By: Chen <dstbtgagt@foxmail.com>

Change-Id: I4b966e25bb49e3645c42ccdb9a89a7fd2a4f423e
Closes-Bug: #1731849

commit_message:
Remove unused connection properties

Refactor iSCSI connect is was introduced in this patch:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455393/.

The method _connect_vol is used for parallelize logins, we shouldn't
give these arguments('target_portals', 'target_iqns', 'target_luns');
and it will also make a mess in the debug message in _connect_vol.
So, just kick them out.

Change-Id: I76fc7645bfe00c3b1653fce4eace8a6430930ad2

commit_message:
Install rsync before os-apply-config

For images without rsync installed (like the Xenial cloud image)
os-apply-config fails with:
```
rsync: command not found
```
This change adds rsync as a package requirement for os-apply-config.

Change-Id: Iae7c6f24176bcd4f6e3040da3d14bbcca0e61163

subject: Mount config-data/puppet-generated/nova for nova_api_ensure_default_cell
messages: [{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-12-18 12:00:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-01-10 22:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-18 12:00:09.000000000', 'message': "Mount config-data/puppet-generated/nova for nova_api_ensure_default_cell

When an update changes NovaPassword, we need to run
nova_api_ensure_default_cell container for it to be able to change
the db_connection for the cells in nova_api db. Otherwise
nova_api_discover_hosts which runs all the time fails with db erorr
as the connection string in the database would not change.

Currently, we don't mount either /var/lib/config-data/nova or
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/nova, hence the
TRIPLEO_CONFIG_HASH is not generated for the container and it
does not run during update and may be not in upgrade either.

Change-Id: I0a972796e45a8df614619c95e9d9be9af183b4e5
Closes-Bug: #1805803
(cherry picked from commit 0012c42e6c5bdd795213c30e419856e66ea90d4c)
"}]
commit_message:
Mount config-data/puppet-generated/nova for nova_api_ensure_default_cell

When an update changes NovaPassword, we need to run
nova_api_ensure_default_cell container for it to be able to change
the db_connection for the cells in nova_api db. Otherwise
nova_api_discover_hosts which runs all the time fails with db erorr
as the connection string in the database would not change.

Currently, we don't mount either /var/lib/config-data/nova or
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/nova, hence the
TRIPLEO_CONFIG_HASH is not generated for the container and it
does not run during update and may be not in upgrade either.

Change-Id: I0a972796e45a8df614619c95e9d9be9af183b4e5
Closes-Bug: #1805803
(cherry picked from commit 0012c42e6c5bdd795213c30e419856e66ea90d4c)

commit_message:
Look for lower-case hostname when adding to ssh_known_hosts

We need to normalize hostnames to lower-case in order to avoid
case discrepancies.

Change-Id: Iaf73f9ae346425881e70500cf3ee28599fc4171a
Partial-Bug: 1809273
(cherry picked from commit c71d234bf8a4a9f23ace6a29ebc570c390a2f7b3)

Change-Id: I12e834996052dae0cd07e5e5092906dd1e8a4f81

commit_message:
Restrict inventory test to devstack-admin

There are multiple different cloud entries in clouds.yaml now. That
means that doing an inventory across all configured clouds gets weird,
especially when we're tossing system scoped accounts in there.

Change-Id: I12e834996052dae0cd07e5e5092906dd1e8a4f81

commit_message:
Run openstackid docs jobs on bionic

The openstackid project is being updated to require a version of PHP
only available on Ubuntu Bionic and later, so to simplify builds of
its docs jobs  run them on ubuntu-bionic nodes where this bindep
requirement is already satisfied.

Change-Id: I94f56c10633c30f2487c990d6a1e6da0bd6581ba

commit_message:
Add Review Priority column to glance repos

This change adds review priority column to glance repos providing
us tools to flag high priority reviews and block changes during
freezes without needing to do it on the code review level.

Change-Id: I3e73d2d4f40e2dbea5d1b723e8e12d719ba7413d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-04 11:37:54.000000000', 'message': "Remove Cinder CI Verified label

At one point the Cinder team had considered having third party CI's vote
on patches, but long ago decided that was not the direction to take.
This removes the ACL setting that would allow a cinder-ci group to vote
on Cinder patches.

Change-Id: Ia7df0dfea3687395d54a4db9e492dd7b186d0642
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove Cinder CI Verified label

At one point the Cinder team had considered having third party CI's vote
on patches, but long ago decided that was not the direction to take.
This removes the ACL setting that would allow a cinder-ci group to vote
on Cinder patches.

Change-Id: Ia7df0dfea3687395d54a4db9e492dd7b186d0642
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

gitignore is not parsing regex, only shell globs,
so '^' has no meaning, and local.conf is being thus tracked.

This patch properly ignores only local.conf in root of repo but still

Change-Id: I93ef778f1f3ee8101ce21cce377f7b527b7153f3

commit_message:
Ignore local.conf in root of repo

gitignore is not parsing regex, only shell globs,
so '^' has no meaning, and local.conf is being thus tracked.

This patch properly ignores only local.conf in root of repo but still
tracks samples/local.conf and others.

Change-Id: I93ef778f1f3ee8101ce21cce377f7b527b7153f3

subject: Consolidate Cinder repo ACL settings
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-04 11:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-04 12:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-01-10 23:35:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-04 11:37:54.000000000', 'message': 'Consolidate Cinder repo ACL settings

The code repos under the Cinder team have the same ACL needs. Rather
than maintaining nearly identical ACL configs for each one, this
configures these repos to use the one common cinder.config file.

This is also to pick up the Review-Priority flag for these other repos.

Change-Id: Ib6fa6844399df54923b1b45726cc1eabeca12737
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Consolidate Cinder repo ACL settings

The code repos under the Cinder team have the same ACL needs. Rather
than maintaining nearly identical ACL configs for each one, this
configures these repos to use the one common cinder.config file.

This is also to pick up the Review-Priority flag for these other repos.

Change-Id: Ib6fa6844399df54923b1b45726cc1eabeca12737
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Restart openshift master services after stack update

For some configs changes, such as the identity providers, it is
necessary to restart the master services in order for them to take
effect.

Change-Id: I6ecb054d0e18acc4dc422a7ce136432d5135c64c
Closes-Bug: #1807668

commit_message:
Set keystone bind_host to both public and admin

Since they are on different networks we need it to
listen on both.

Change-Id: I6ac6d13b588a92818cd41b8697c6b4389e42aeba

(26 comments)

Loads of nits. I'm basically +1 except for the few non-nit comments in there. If you can address those, I'm good"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-01 14:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

not i had a meeting with melonox who i will be collaberating with on this spec.

the agenda and summary were captured here https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/sriov-live-migration

also capturing summary here for prosperity 

Meeting Summary 24.10.18

    Aligned on the general direction of libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration spec

    POC code will be modified to use VifMigrateData object instead of extending the LiveMigrateData object

    find out if PCI allocation is required for vifs

    Claim the PCI resource and update the destination vif profile

    extend pci_resource tracker API to allow freeing claimed/allocated resources.

    Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607365/1 modifications:

    modify method signature to accept per port ID vnic_type and profile which will override the corresponding vif vnic_type and profile

    For the feature to be fully supported, neutron side mechanism driver and agent will need to support mulitple port bindings

    Will need to be addresses as a separate neutron blueprint/spec for unsupporting ml2 mech-drivers (e.g SR-IOV macVtap) \

    Maybe its worth mentioning this limitation in the Spec ?

    It seems that updating guest XML with the target PCI device will not be required in both direct and indirect mode - Sean to update spec

    Dealing with migration between different NIC vendors is not a part of the current spec.

    Supporting Net-failover shall not be addressed as part of the spec, however this can be mentioned as a future work item that can be built on top of this spec

    Agreed work items and owners:

    Spec: Sean-K-Mooney

    PCI resource allocation and indirect live-migration support : Adrianc

    Direct live-migration support : Sean-K-Mooney


i wil make the cnages stephen suggested + the changes  form the meeting today'}, {'account_id': 25733, 'date': '2018-11-05 15:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

From a technical perspective this looks pretty solid to me. I presume that live port attach/detach would need to be supported in order for this spec to be implemented?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-06 13:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(5 comments)

live attach detach would need to be supported by the hypervior yes
but it does not need to be supported by the nova api.

e.g. we can enable this automatic attach detach without allowing endusers to attach or detach sriov interfaces from the api.

we could enable the second usecase at some point in the future but that is out of scope of this spec as it has edge cases i do not want o currently address as it adds complexity that is not needed to support the basic use case of live migration.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-06 13:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2018-11-22 12:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29577, 'date': '2018-11-26 22:18:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29577, 'date': '2018-11-26 23:06:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-11-29 17:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(12 comments)

Sorry but I feel we need more explanation on how you plan to support this feature in a cloud where old computes could get some workloads to be migrated to some new computes.

Also, I feel we need a bit more of details about the proposal itself.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-29 19:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(9 comments)

migration form odl->new and new->old will
disable this feature just as we do with multiple port bindings

we will only use it if both nodes support it.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-29 19:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

thanks for the feedback ill make change and submit again tomorow'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-29 19:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

i should also point out the is a POC implementation of this feature available for review also here
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620115/1'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2018-12-04 09:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-12-04 23:13:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

sorry didnt get to this yet but ill update soon.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-12-06 14:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-12-10 16:00:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(8 comments)

This fixes a nasty corner case and would be good to tackle now while we're rebuilding knowledge in the area (the CPU pinning/NUMA live migration spec). The resource claim aspect of this isn't my strong suit but everything about the PCI manager/SR-IOV in general reads correct.

There are some grammar/spellings nits included, but nothing I'd worry about unless you need to respin."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-12-10 18:19:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(39 comments)

commit_message:
Add spec for sriov live migration

- This change introduces a spec to describe
  extension of the nova libvirt driver to
  support live migration of guests with
  SR-IOV interfaces.

blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration

Change-Id: Ic2650ec51f9f97f3db3dbda049863ce2c538af34

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-09 22:17:52.000000000', 'message': 'Change ssh_utils parameter to correctly send keepalive packets

The current implementation of ssh_utils never sends keepalive packets.
In ssh_utils.SSHPool, the socket timeout parameter is set to None
intending to keep ssh connections open.
However, when the parameter is set to None, ssh_utils does not run the
code to compare idle duration and keepalive interval.

This patch reverts the socket timeout parameter to default (0.1 sec).
The ssh_utils compares them every 0.1 seconds, and sends a keepalive
packet if idle duration > keepalive interval (= self.conn_timeout).

See cinder change: I8234083107207b9ebc0849947e8de92b5cf3e36e

Change-Id: Ib13e5c6246412d667554cb0bd9c419b513af70c7
Related-Bug: #1673662
(cherry picked from commit 1814ad41134a2fa952ea6b664984da07d46d17c3)
'}]
commit_message:
Change ssh_utils parameter to correctly send keepalive packets

The current implementation of ssh_utils never sends keepalive packets.
In ssh_utils.SSHPool, the socket timeout parameter is set to None
intending to keep ssh connections open.
However, when the parameter is set to None, ssh_utils does not run the
code to compare idle duration and keepalive interval.

This patch reverts the socket timeout parameter to default (0.1 sec).
The ssh_utils compares them every 0.1 seconds, and sends a keepalive
packet if idle duration > keepalive interval (= self.conn_timeout).

See cinder change: I8234083107207b9ebc0849947e8de92b5cf3e36e

Change-Id: Ib13e5c6246412d667554cb0bd9c419b513af70c7
Related-Bug: #1673662
(cherry picked from commit 1814ad41134a2fa952ea6b664984da07d46d17c3)

messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-12-19 21:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-08 22:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-01-10 20:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 21:49:51.000000000', 'message': 'Restore correct signal handling in Python3

The patch c8c8946d3281ef65de70b03dd198b6be6257fa7f broke the original
fix cad75e4e139f734a5138d37ceafa6be169ff4e47 that ensured eventlet could
be interrupted while sleeping after PEP475 was implemented in Python
3.5. Eventlet monkey-patches the signal module with its own version, so
we have to look up the original module to determine whether the
underlying OS actually supports the poll() function.

Change-Id: Ia712c9a83d8081bf0b5e6fe36f169f9028aae3dc
Closes-Bug: #1803731
Related-Bug: #1788022
Related-Bug: #1705047
(cherry picked from commit 159ef2e1d26f25a5d7a0514d5155f3c74c4a8a86)
'}]
commit_message:
Restore correct signal handling in Python3

The patch c8c8946d3281ef65de70b03dd198b6be6257fa7f broke the original
fix cad75e4e139f734a5138d37ceafa6be169ff4e47 that ensured eventlet could
be interrupted while sleeping after PEP475 was implemented in Python
3.5. Eventlet monkey-patches the signal module with its own version, so
we have to look up the original module to determine whether the
underlying OS actually supports the poll() function.

Change-Id: Ia712c9a83d8081bf0b5e6fe36f169f9028aae3dc
Closes-Bug: #1803731
Related-Bug: #1788022
Related-Bug: #1705047
(cherry picked from commit 159ef2e1d26f25a5d7a0514d5155f3c74c4a8a86)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-09 11:45:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix updating nodes with removed or broken drivers

Currently when updating a node we try to acquire the lock on it using
its old database record, including its old driver. This is not correct
when updating a driver, since the current conductor may not have access
to the old driver (and the old driver may no longer be enabled at all).

Since we do not need task.driver at all when updating nodes, this change
stops populating it in update_node.

Change-Id: I510c3bfbd11b01fef05341be2bb04c6bd01bf8ac
Story: #2004741
Task: #28812
'}]
commit_message:
Fix updating nodes with removed or broken drivers

Currently when updating a node we try to acquire the lock on it using
its old database record, including its old driver. This is not correct
when updating a driver, since the current conductor may not have access
to the old driver (and the old driver may no longer be enabled at all).

Since we do not need task.driver at all when updating nodes, this change
stops populating it in update_node.

Change-Id: I510c3bfbd11b01fef05341be2bb04c6bd01bf8ac
Story: #2004741
Task: #28812

commit_message:
Fixed description in Metadata tab in Edit/Create Image dialog

Changed class of the text container from col-md-12 to col-md-11
to prevent it from hiding by the question mark.

Change-Id: I9c28fd706fc27a87e2e054d79fb4933d5acb0717

[{'created': '2019-01-06 16:22:21.000000000', 'message': 'Decorate Javascript i18n with a last_modified header

Every request to horizon fetches the js i18n catalog because
it has no caching information, which is a huge overhead, given
that the server side is also not caching anything. Follow
advice in Django documentation on how to inject a last modified
header

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.11/topics/i18n/translation/#note-on-performance

Change-Id: I96b849836f738c8d42c23cc47f4e575d7eb1af71
'}]
commit_message:
Decorate Javascript i18n with a last_modified header

Every request to horizon fetches the js i18n catalog because
it has no caching information, which is a huge overhead, given
that the server side is also not caching anything. Follow
advice in Django documentation on how to inject a last modified
header

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.11/topics/i18n/translation/#note-on-performance

Change-Id: I96b849836f738c8d42c23cc47f4e575d7eb1af71

commit_message:
SG creation user taken straight to edit rules

When the user creates a security group they are taken straight to
manage security group and can select and make changes to rules.

Change-Id: I2b3422e7816fabf59aca87a76f19cba96f01bddc
closes-bug: #1292084

`syncdb` subcommand was deprecated in django 1.7 and subsequently
removed in 1.9. We need to use 'manage.py migrate'.

This commit also drops a sample output of 'manage.py migrate'.
I don't think we need to maintain this kind of output and
it can change per Django release.

Closes-Bug: #1777358

commit_message:
doc: Use `manage.py migrate`

`syncdb` subcommand was deprecated in django 1.7 and subsequently
removed in 1.9. We need to use 'manage.py migrate'.

This commit also drops a sample output of 'manage.py migrate'.
I don't think we need to maintain this kind of output and
it can change per Django release.

Closes-Bug: #1777358

Reference: https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/http/sessions/#using-database-backed-sessions

Change-Id: Ib3a7e50584a8deb9bee409335464163b7b1258d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 14:37:00.000000000', 'message': 'volume_groups test: use create_mocks from test helper

project/volume_groups/tests.py defines its own create_mocks decorator.
It was implemented when the migration from mox to mock was being done
and we forgot to clean up its own create_mocks decorator.
This commit updates the tests to use test.helper.create_mocks.

It also replaces mock.patch.object with create_mocks for consistency.

Change-Id: I2196373a888563fa5aaa8b62255be62260f2dd7f
'}]
commit_message:
volume_groups test: use create_mocks from test helper

project/volume_groups/tests.py defines its own create_mocks decorator.
It was implemented when the migration from mox to mock was being done
and we forgot to clean up its own create_mocks decorator.
This commit updates the tests to use test.helper.create_mocks.

It also replaces mock.patch.object with create_mocks for consistency.

Change-Id: I2196373a888563fa5aaa8b62255be62260f2dd7f

commit_message:
Provide partial-completed progress bar for DataTable status columns.

Current progress bar for a status column is always 100%.
We need to provide a way for the DataTable to show incompleted status.
For some long operations, this is not so user friendly.

Closes-Bug: 1811046

Change-Id: Idf1ff00e5989ff347419faad2218becbe6d4415e
Signed-off-by: Yan Chen <yan.chen@intel.com>

commit_message:
Snmp - Use net_cidr_map for firewall rules

Change I68e064d23ec5d43f59146d974cae604d2c5fdb52 makes
NetCidrMapValue a list of ip networks.

Iterate over the list of cidr' from the SnmpdNetwork
entry in the cidr map and create firewall rules for
each ip network.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I52080771f5ed0763f0d6a799c0c98a6dae94eafe

commit_message:
Memcached - Use net_cidr_map for firewall rules

Change I68e064d23ec5d43f59146d974cae604d2c5fdb52 makes
NetCidrMapValue a list of ip networks.

Iterate over the list of cidr' from the MemcachedNetwork
entry in the cidr map and create firewall rules for each
ip network.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I7e3d8127b9d3d8c09327f90ccb26ae1bc62565ad

Needs - https://review.openstack.org/621673'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-12 01:02:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-12 21:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-12 22:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/tripleo-routed-networks to bp/tripleo-routed-networks-templates'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-12-13 14:26:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hmm, why did this not run scenario003? That's where designate gets tested. :-/"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-15 09:28:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

recheck

Let's see if scenario003 run now."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-17 23:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

The rndc_allowed_addresses resolve to an empty list in standalone. This is'nt correct.

"tripleo::profile::base::designate::rndc_allowed_addresses": [],'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-18 03:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-18 04:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> The rndc_allowed_addresses resolve to an empty list in standalone.
 > This is'nt correct.
 > 
 > "tripleo::profile::base::designate::rndc_allowed_addresses": [],

Interesting. I am currently having issues with standalone returning empty address lists for another thing I'm working on. I wonder if something broke and we didn't notice because it wasn't being used.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-18 17:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> > The rndc_allowed_addresses resolve to an empty list in
 > standalone.
 > > This is'nt correct.
 > >
 > > "tripleo::profile::base::designate::rndc_allowed_addresses": [],
 > 
 > Interesting. I am currently having issues with standalone returning
 > empty address lists for another thing I'm working on. I wonder if
 > something broke and we didn't notice because it wasn't being used.

It's possible, I had done all my testing in environment with isolated-networks. Since the networks we reference by default in ServiceNetMap have values the correct list of IP networks was set.

With standalone, and deployments without isolated networks however we use OS::Heat::None resources. So we ended up with 'null' which I previously replaced with [] to not fail a map merge in ServiceChains output.

I now fall back to the ctlplane cidrs instead, see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613459/16/network/networks.j2.yaml

Whith this change we get the correct data, afaict:

http://logs.openstack.org/47/619647/8/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-standalone/473a198/logs/undercloud/etc/puppet/hieradata/service_configs.json.txt.gz


    "tripleo::profile::base::designate::rndc_allowed_addresses": [
        "192.168.24.1/24"
    ],


tbh, I would like to change ServiceNetMap to have ctlplane as the default for everything, and then depending on the networks that are enabled we could override the ServiceNetMap in the environments/isolated-networks.j2.yaml. The problem is I think a lot of people copied the isolated-networks file and include the copy in the environment when deploying, so changeing this would probably break quite a few deployments on upgrade.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-12-21 18:38:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

At least doesn't seem to have broken the ci configuration, so this works for me. I doubt I'll have a chance to test it in a routed networks situation."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-30 18:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-12-31 03:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

The designate service configures the dns backend security

remotely control the nameserver.

commit_message:
Designate - Use net_cidr_map for rndc_allowed_addresses

Change I68e064d23ec5d43f59146d974cae604d2c5fdb52 makes
NetCidrMapValue a list of ip networks.

The designate service configures the dns backend security
to contol from wich addresses updates are allowed. We
should use the list of cidr's associated with the
DesignateApiNetwork to allow all nodes in the network to
remotely control the nameserver.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I5c5cd51c8f127e8879c5528883c3abd261f4a5b3

commit_message:
Apache - Use net_cidr_map for proxy_ips

Change I68e064d23ec5d43f59146d974cae604d2c5fdb52 makes
NetCidrMapValue a list of ip networks.

Pass the list of cidr's from the ApacheNetwork entry in
the cidr map to 'apache::mod::remoteip::proxy_ips:'.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: Ieb6aff9889136f0ccbec32e36b46140aa7826019

[{'created': '2018-12-18 06:33:49.000000000', 'message': "Autodiscover SSL cert after uc upgrade

SSL is enabled on uc by default starting from R,
so here is a way how ssl cert path is resolved:
  1. If undercloud_service_certificate configured in undercloud.conf
      use it
  2. Check if generate_service_certificate is specified and
      set to 'true' in undercloud.conf, or not present in undercloud.conf
     (defaults to 'true')
  3. Find autogenerated file in format:
     /etc/pki/tls/certs/undercloud-[undercloud_public_host].pem

Change-Id: I014474001882874d84c4a60f35bd33db77baf55a
(cherry picked from commit 96b4bec38d6662e1b2776d255ef1dc5155934e3c)

commit_message:
Autodiscover SSL cert after uc upgrade

SSL is enabled on uc by default starting from R,
so here is a way how ssl cert path is resolved:
  1. If undercloud_service_certificate configured in undercloud.conf
      use it
  2. Check if generate_service_certificate is specified and
      set to 'true' in undercloud.conf, or not present in undercloud.conf
     (defaults to 'true')
  3. Find autogenerated file in format:
     /etc/pki/tls/certs/undercloud-[undercloud_public_host].pem

Change-Id: I014474001882874d84c4a60f35bd33db77baf55a
(cherry picked from commit 96b4bec38d6662e1b2776d255ef1dc5155934e3c)

Unfortuenatly I belive all the CI jobs use a static network-environment.yaml, not the one that is jinja rendered, i.f using the j2 template changed here.

 See bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1776186'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-10-09 14:58:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I wonder if we should add a releasenote? (And fix the nit's in commit message)"}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-10-10 13:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

As much as I hate to -2 a patch with good intentions, at this point I don't think we can merge this change, because it will break upgrades for anyone who has deployed with IPv6 previously and uses an IPv4 Tenant network. In fact, Heat will try to delete the Tenant ports and network from the stack, which will both fail and leave Heat in a state that cannot be automatically recovered. I can see a few options:
1) Create a new set of files, such as network-isolation-v6-all.yaml, etc.
2) Modify the Jinja so that the Tenant network will only use IPv6 if the Tenant network is set with "ipv6: true" in network_data.yaml
3) Create a new environment file (E.G. network-isolation-tenant-v6.yaml) that specifically only sets the Tenant network to IPv6, which would only be used for new deployments and not upgrades. However this file would have to be included after the other network environment files on the deploy command-line to ensure that the parameters were overridden.'}, {'account_id': 20866, 'date': '2018-10-24 09:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> As much as I hate to -2 a patch with good intentions, at this point
 > I don't think we can merge this change, because it will break
 > upgrades for anyone who has deployed with IPv6 previously and uses
 > an IPv4 Tenant network. In fact, Heat will try to delete the Tenant
 > ports and network from the stack, which will both fail and leave
 > Heat in a state that cannot be automatically recovered. I can see a
 > few options:
 > 1) Create a new set of files, such as network-isolation-v6-all.yaml,
 > etc.
I like this.
 > 2) Modify the Jinja so that the Tenant network will only use IPv6
 > if the Tenant network is set with "ipv6: true" in network_data.yaml
Will this not break upgrades?
 > 3) Create a new environment file (E.G. network-isolation-tenant-v6.yaml)
 > that specifically only sets the Tenant network to IPv6, which would
 > only be used for new deployments and not upgrades. However this
 > file would have to be included after the other network environment
 > files on the deploy command-line to ensure that the parameters were
 > overridden.
This can be a bit confusing to users and error-prone.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-10-24 22:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Replying to Janki's question:
> 2) Modify the Jinja so that the Tenant network will only use IPv6
> if the Tenant network is set with "ipv6: true" in network_data.yaml
Will this not break upgrades?

This should not break upgrades, since the tenant network defaults to IPv4. Users would have to specifically modify the Tenant network in network_data.yaml to indicate that "ipv6: true", but this will fail when performing an upgrade. The networks defined in network_data.yaml must match the existing networks.'}, {'account_id': 20866, 'date': '2018-11-23 09:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-11-26 12:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Add a release notes, and a docs patch for explaining the "-all" environments (with update/upgrade warning) would be good to have as a follow-up.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-12-04 06:49:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

This is on the right track, but I'd like to see network_data*.yaml get updated to correct the comment, and a releasenote."}, {'account_id': 20866, 'date': '2018-12-04 07:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-12-04 21:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Allow overlay tunnel endpoints on IPv6 address

Overlay tunnel endpoints are supported only on
IPv4 address. Now that OVS and Neutron support
having v6 endpoints, edit network enviroment
files in TripleO to allow this.

Change-Id: Ie2523cf4e359289298e4ea5d0992093976a19e04
Closes-Bug: #1793239

commit_message:
Set paramiko logging to DEBUG level

Connections to backends via paramiko often fail for obscure
reasons.

If the service log level is DEBUG, increase paramiko logging
to DEBUG level as well so that we have more information when issues
of this sort occur.

Change-Id: I44d8902d58c2ad48b8a37dfbff96c5b9471651e4
(cherry picked from commit 575d6ae62140681b0be6ef2eccec5b3664524a6d)

subject: Mount the public TLS certificate for HAProxy on up(date|grade) on pacemaker
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-13 15:40:48.000000000', 'message': 'Mount the public TLS certificate for HAProxy on up(date|grade) on pacemaker

As part of the minor update workflow and the update workflow, this changes
the pacemaker haproxy bundle resource to add the needed mount for public
TLS to work.

This also handles the reloading of the container to fetch any new certificates
and if needed, it will restart the pacemaker resource (for upgrades), since
we would need pacemaker to re-create the resource.

Change-Id: I850f4de17e7f7e3b46deb27119227ef76658dcb5
Closes-Bug: #1759797
(cherry picked from commit 8b85faf7e66a49977f7fd18512e1534488ca4f07)
'}]
commit_message:
Mount the public TLS certificate for HAProxy on up(date|grade) on pacemaker

As part of the minor update workflow and the update workflow, this changes
the pacemaker haproxy bundle resource to add the needed mount for public
TLS to work.

This also handles the reloading of the container to fetch any new certificates
and if needed, it will restart the pacemaker resource (for upgrades), since
we would need pacemaker to re-create the resource.

Change-Id: I850f4de17e7f7e3b46deb27119227ef76658dcb5
Closes-Bug: #1759797
(cherry picked from commit 8b85faf7e66a49977f7fd18512e1534488ca4f07)

subject: Don't include port numbers in insecure registries
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-01-10 01:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-01-10 20:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nThis breaks podman pull, so I think the issue with builda pull is old vendored code not handling ports'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-10 01:39:49.000000000', 'message': "Don't include port numbers in insecure registries

In change I4fe4c3176056dc1355ea631a214f4c3d2f6efb00, doing a buildah
pull is failing because the contents of registries.conf is invalid.
This change removes the port numbers from the insecure registries
list, so that only the IP addresses are written.

Change-Id: Ie4fd4d8ee5504e711b167ab1a4e3bc0ce82d5256
Blueprint: podman-support
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include port numbers in insecure registries

In change I4fe4c3176056dc1355ea631a214f4c3d2f6efb00, doing a buildah
pull is failing because the contents of registries.conf is invalid.
This change removes the port numbers from the insecure registries
list, so that only the IP addresses are written.

Change-Id: Ie4fd4d8ee5504e711b167ab1a4e3bc0ce82d5256
Blueprint: podman-support

commit_message:
Fixed ability of usage interfaces/bridges with dots (aliases)

Without quoting network interface, dot in it's name caused json_query
to fail with JMESPathError, as dot was interpreted as a key in dict.

Change-Id: I1702567325f7b4f973cb6fcfc35ccae54d7aa5fa
(cherry picked from commit 9f6bf94d1a922553f7bc9b3a614b857b666822db)

commit_message:
Fixed ability of usage interfaces/bridges with dots (aliases)

Without quoting network interface, dot in it's name caused json_query
to fail with JMESPathError, as dot was interpreted as a key in dict.

Change-Id: I1702567325f7b4f973cb6fcfc35ccae54d7aa5fa

subject: Add gerritbot to #opendev
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-01-10 19:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-01-10 19:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-10 19:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

LGTM - one question inline.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-01-10 19:24:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't like seeing all the announcements twice, having a clear switch would seem much better to me."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-01-10 19:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-01-10 19:38:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Jens, I don't think we're ready to make a switch yet, but there's a lot of activity around setting up services for opendev, and it would be nice to have a place to talk about that publicly without being a distraction in -infra."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-01-10 19:55:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I think we should go ahead and get this in to enable collaboration. Most IRC clients allow you to set up ignore rules (or similar) on a per channel basis. This should allow you to ignore the openstackgerrit nick in #openstack-infra and only listen to it in #opendev (or vice versa).

Irssi's docs on setting that up: https://irssi.org/documentation/help/ignore/ as an example.

We can also further refine the list of repos as things move along and get more permanent homes."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-01-10 19:55:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't believe there has been a clear decision that there will be a *switch*.

It is clear that opendev, as an effort, needs a channel, because its users will need a place to talk to people.

However, the OpenStack project might decide to keep an Infrastructure team of some sort and that team might decide to remain in #openstack-infra.

I'm not sure it'll be clear whether #openstack-infra will be sunset before opendev has been established ... so while I understand not liking duplication, I think we might need to straddle that for now."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-10 19:00:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add gerritbot to #opendev

And duplicate all the #openstack-infra channels for now

Change-Id: Ie39883391b4c105052fd3563d644e63b80677078
'}]
commit_message:
Add gerritbot to #opendev

And duplicate all the #openstack-infra channels for now

Change-Id: Ie39883391b4c105052fd3563d644e63b80677078

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-07 11:12:54.000000000', 'message': 'Support standard config file path for monasca-api

The standard path is /etc/monasca/monasca-api.conf (instead of
/etc/monasca/api.conf).

/etc/monasca/api.conf and /etc/monasca/api-config.conf are still
supported but a deprectation message is printed.

Change-Id: I94e853f869db7b0a434a1a05517255ae62131132

commit_message:
Support standard config file path for monasca-api

The standard path is /etc/monasca/monasca-api.conf (instead of
/etc/monasca/api.conf).

/etc/monasca/api.conf and /etc/monasca/api-config.conf are still
supported (in case the new file paths are not available) but a
deprectation message is printed.

Story: 2004708
Task:  28738

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628936/
Change-Id: I94e853f869db7b0a434a1a05517255ae62131132

commit_message:
Remove unused local copies of fontawesome

These files were unused, since we instead refer to the CDN-hosted
version in css.tmpl, so remove them to avoid confusion.  We can add a
separate local file for any overrides or other additions.

Change-Id: I4cf7041df949b74a62763fabdab6bf380ad34b97

commit_message:
Remove NovaImages.list_images from nova rally tests

This removes the NovaImages.list_images test from the rally
tests defined in the nova chart, as the updated rally version
seemingly doesn't include this test. This caused the multinode
periodic job to fail.

See: http://zuul.openstack.org/build/9628003399d640e683945260d9738ade

Change-Id: I9515fc3fee192ee6636e85a745071f93ff86c051

[{'created': '2019-01-09 23:24:04.000000000', 'message': "Chrony: new NTP server defaults

This patch drops the offline option because this role usually
applies to always-on machines and the subsystem which detects
if you're online or offline seems to be largely unstable which
causes chronyd to never attempt to synchronize time.

It also drops the minpoll and maxpoll options to leave it to
the defaults of the chronyd service, this is due to the numbers
provided not allowing the system to properly sync up time.

It also adds the 'iburst' option which will send a few quick
bursts when the system first goes up in order to get it to sync
up with time faster.

Change-Id: Iad41ef505f5a1c142ec7ffe07e4a1c08aa614235

commit_message:
Chrony: new NTP server defaults

This patch drops the offline option because this role usually
applies to always-on machines and the subsystem which detects
if you're online or offline seems to be largely unstable which
causes chronyd to never attempt to synchronize time.

It also drops the minpoll and maxpoll options to leave it to
the defaults of the chronyd service, this is due to the numbers
provided not allowing the system to properly sync up time.

It also adds the 'iburst' option which will send a few quick
bursts when the system first goes up in order to get it to sync
up with time faster.

Change-Id: Iad41ef505f5a1c142ec7ffe07e4a1c08aa614235

commit_message:
Chrony: add an option to sync the hardware clock

Provide the possibility to allow users to synchronize
the RTC. It is (still) disabled by default, since
certain combinations of linux kernel version and
hardware pieces are subject to cause lockups.

"rtcautotrim 10" and rtcfile have been favoured over
"rtcsync" since "rtcsync" syncs the RTC every 11 seconds
which is not necessary IMO. "rtcautotrim 10" will only
set the time to the RTC if the gap between RTC and
the system clock exceed more than 10 seconds.

Change-Id: I2961bc554eb6caf6e6c78137a33c4fde256ae1ff

commit_message:
Chrony: make ntp server options configurable

Users may wish to remove the 'offline' option for increased
reliability, since ifup/ifdown scripts are typically not
required in (static) server environments. Futhermore it
enables users to adjust the polling timers to their needs.

Change-Id: Iafa31c03e98785a574f38bb2206b9bea9550743e

Using dynamic inclusion (include_tasks) should only be done
if the tasks to include are based on a conditional. Using
include_tasks for static inclusion dramatically raises memory
consumption. Using include_tasks also breaks the ability to
use tags for any included tasks.

In this patch we switch all inclusions to be static, as this
role relies heavily on tags. The only place a dynamic inclusion
is left is for the contrib tasks - this is left to be dynamic
given that none are included at this time.

We also remove the unnecessary leading whitespace in the main
task file.

Change-Id: Idff86d4a90d3309f0e9ae3b9f0559b37e25dc26f

include_tasks for static inclusion dramatically raises memory
consumption. Using include_tasks also breaks the ability to
use tags for any included tasks.

In this patch we switch all inclusions to be static, as this
role relies heavily on tags. The only place a dynamic inclusion
is left is for the contrib tasks - this is left to be dynamic
given that none are included at this time.

We also remove the unnecessary leading whitespace in the main
task file.

Change-Id: Idff86d4a90d3309f0e9ae3b9f0559b37e25dc26f
Closes-Bug: #1800169
'}, {'created': '2019-01-08 11:54:31.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to using import_tasks for static inclusion

Using dynamic inclusion (include_tasks) should only be done
if the tasks to include are based on a conditional and there
is no expectation for the tag on the include task to be applied
to all included tasks. Using include_tasks for static inclusion
dramatically raises memory consumption. Using include_tasks also
breaks the ability to use a tag applied to the include.

In this patch we fix all inclusions to ensure that they are set
properly to dynamic or static inclusions where necessary.

We also remove the unnecessary leading whitespace in the main
task file.

Change-Id: Idff86d4a90d3309f0e9ae3b9f0559b37e25dc26f
Closes-Bug: #1800169
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to using import_tasks for static inclusion

Using dynamic inclusion (include_tasks) should only be done
if the tasks to include are based on a conditional and there
is no expectation for the tag on the include task to be applied
to all included tasks. Using include_tasks for static inclusion
dramatically raises memory consumption. Using include_tasks also
breaks the ability to use a tag applied to the include.

In this patch we fix all inclusions to ensure that they are set
properly to dynamic or static inclusions where necessary.

We also remove the unnecessary leading whitespace in the main
task file.

Change-Id: Idff86d4a90d3309f0e9ae3b9f0559b37e25dc26f
Closes-Bug: #1800169

commit_message:
Mark never-released xstatic modules as deprecated

Those modules were part of an angular transition that was never
completed. Ignore them in release management, until they are
fully retired.

Change-Id: I55859dfadf56477f05b81d174225f4215c04f496

messages: [{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-10 08:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-01-10 09:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-10 13:48:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-10 18:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-10 08:48:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix WordCompleter import

Since May 2018 [1], the WordCompleter and PathCompleter moved
from prompt_toolkit 's contrib module to prompt_toolkit.completion

Without this patch, it is impossible to use the interactive-release
CLI with the latest versions of prompt_toolkit, which is not freezed
in the requirements.

This fixes the issue by using the latest way to import WordCompleter
and ensuring users will have the latest prompt_toolkit versions
compatible with this change.

[1]: https://github.com/prompt-toolkit/python-prompt-toolkit/commit/8d12c16081a50c8baa6b0b4050a195f798b12331#diff-c25fe0509d70181361304341982e6d0f

Change-Id: Ia9180a10f0aa8f6f8ed25d7fd5e4e3ec39f86714
"}]
commit_message:
Fix WordCompleter import

Since May 2018 [1], the WordCompleter and PathCompleter moved
from prompt_toolkit 's contrib module to prompt_toolkit.completion

Without this patch, it is impossible to use the interactive-release
CLI with the latest versions of prompt_toolkit, which is not freezed
in the requirements.

This fixes the issue by using the latest way to import WordCompleter
and ensuring users will have the latest prompt_toolkit versions
compatible with this change.

[1]: https://github.com/prompt-toolkit/python-prompt-toolkit/commit/8d12c16081a50c8baa6b0b4050a195f798b12331#diff-c25fe0509d70181361304341982e6d0f

Change-Id: Ia9180a10f0aa8f6f8ed25d7fd5e4e3ec39f86714

commit_message:
Some polish for APIv2

- update_keypair now only in v2 schema
- tenant_id->project_id in cluster provision steps
- tenant_id->project_id in referenced job binaries in job templates
- proper check for job template existence, to fail early (as intended)
- hadoop_version->plugin_version for query string filter
- unbreak some data source stuff (related to tenant_id->project_id)
- fix omission of show_progress from cluster GET query string whitelist
- job_id->job_template_id for v2 jobs
- add missing release note info for strict query string checking
- release notes for all the rest

Change-Id: Idea117c406b5ab9b8d85ccf8adb175053416d6ff
Story: 2004505
Task: 28822

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 17:10:48.000000000', 'message': 'make tox docs environment follow PTI guidelines for sphinx build

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation
says:

    Note:

    We strongly discourage project teams from adding commands to the
    docs environment beyond:

        sphinx-build -W -b html doc/source doc/build/html

Discussion on #openstack-doc prompted the suggestion to adjust the
cookiecutter templates accordingly:

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-doc/%23openstack-doc.2018-08-09.log.html#t2018-08-09T16:04:54

Change-Id: Ib3733daffb724fa13267aec6ac4f14cb91bcd5ba
'}, {'created': '2018-08-09 17:57:01.000000000', 'message': 'make tox docs environment follow PTI guidelines for sphinx build

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation
says:

    Note:

    We strongly discourage project teams from adding commands to the
    docs environment beyond:

        sphinx-build -W -b html doc/source doc/build/html

Discussion on #openstack-doc prompted the suggestion to adjust the
cookiecutter templates accordingly:

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-doc/%23openstack-doc.2018-08-09.log.html#t2018-08-09T16:04:54

Also update requirements.txt.

Change-Id: Ib3733daffb724fa13267aec6ac4f14cb91bcd5ba
'}]
commit_message:
make tox docs environment follow PTI guidelines for sphinx build

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation
says:

    Note:

    We strongly discourage project teams from adding commands to the
    docs environment beyond:

        sphinx-build -W -b html doc/source doc/build/html

Discussion on #openstack-doc prompted the suggestion to adjust the
cookiecutter templates accordingly:

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-doc/%23openstack-doc.2018-08-09.log.html#t2018-08-09T16:04:54

Also update requirements.txt.

Change-Id: Ib3733daffb724fa13267aec6ac4f14cb91bcd5ba

[{'created': '2017-10-09 15:44:54.000000000', 'message': "Switch R10K external module installation to Ansible

With the introduction of Zuulv3, we will likely make run_tests.sh
all use Ansible instead of shell code.  However, to avoid a huge
refactor, it's likely best to refactor small components to playbooks
and slowly abstract them into one big one.

Due to the large number of failures installing external modules,
this patch extracts the installation of external modules into a
role that's ran by a playbook which is manually triggered in
run_tests.sh for now.  It will retry 5 times with a 300 second
timeout on each attempt.  This should reduce the number of gate
failures.

commit_message:
Switch R10K external module installation to Ansible

With the introduction of Zuulv3, we will likely make run_tests.sh
all use Ansible instead of shell code.  However, to avoid a huge
refactor, it's likely best to refactor small components to playbooks
and slowly abstract them into one big one.

Due to the large number of failures installing external modules,
this patch extracts the installation of external modules into a
role that's ran by a playbook which is manually triggered in
run_tests.sh for now.  It will retry 5 times with a 300 second
timeout on each attempt.  This should reduce the number of gate
failures.

Change-Id: I66d81ff39edf237c9f4d0e30027faca72aebf112

[{'created': '2019-01-10 16:35:54.000000000', 'message': 'Release ironic-lib 2.16.1

An updated version of ironic-lib in order to help
reduce gate issues we are observing in ironic where
our integration test nodes are experiencing sporatic
extreme IO latency. The hope is that this fix addresses
the cases where IO latency can become problematic for
the integration test.

Change-Id: Ia672664b933d04d87486cc569b58c224dcc35c1f
'}]
commit_message:
Release ironic-lib 2.16.1

An updated version of ironic-lib in order to help
reduce gate issues we are observing in ironic where
our integration test nodes are experiencing sporatic
extreme IO latency. The hope is that this fix addresses
the cases where IO latency can become problematic for
the integration test.

Change-Id: Ia672664b933d04d87486cc569b58c224dcc35c1f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-05 22:45:20.000000000', 'message': "vars: stop placing neutron_developer_constraints in vars

There is no specific reason for placing neutron_developer_constraints
inside vars and it doesn't let the user override them if they want to
use specific constraints (i.e. install from PyPI directly instead of
installing from Git)

Change-Id: I08f9b67c5bd8fc1c8c4e31449e9a107548cd08b0
"}]
commit_message:
vars: stop placing neutron_developer_constraints in vars

There is no specific reason for placing neutron_developer_constraints
inside vars and it doesn't let the user override them if they want to
use specific constraints (i.e. install from PyPI directly instead of
installing from Git)

Change-Id: I08f9b67c5bd8fc1c8c4e31449e9a107548cd08b0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-05 04:25:58.000000000', 'message': 'venv: use inventory_hostname instead of ansible_hostname

It is possible that the hostname of the system does not match the
one in the inventory which means that the delegate_to or the
comparision to inventory_hostname will fail in the tasks later.

Change-Id: Id5df93612d71f8f1ba14fae9cbf28cb6a645fd4e
'}]
commit_message:
venv: use inventory_hostname instead of ansible_hostname

It is possible that the hostname of the system does not match the
one in the inventory which means that the delegate_to or the
comparision to inventory_hostname will fail in the tasks later.

Change-Id: Id5df93612d71f8f1ba14fae9cbf28cb6a645fd4e

Doc: Remove unnecessary note

Cinder v1 API is removed and hence the note on the docs seems
unnecessary.
This patch removes it.

Change-Id: I509a757a189c4f44c35623cabf83b93eaa34d483

commit_message:
Remove DhcpStart and DhcpEnd - Replaced by AllocationPools

THT change Ifdf3e9d22766c1b5ede151979b93754a3d244cc3 switched
to use the AllocationPools parameter, replacing use of the
DhcpStart and DhcpEnd parameters.

Change-Id: Ia96c3af388c40c0bd6ca2b58d1ac5a242608c89d
Related-Bug: #1806512
Depends-On: Ifdf3e9d22766c1b5ede151979b93754a3d244cc3

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-02 22:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The "api" tests fail, while the "clients" tests pass.

The base explanation is, "api" tests are making calls which lack the /v1.1'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-02 22:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-01-03 00:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> The "api" tests fail, while the "clients" tests pass.
 > 
 > The base explanation is, "api" tests are making calls which lack
 > the /v1.1

Yes, but I was not sure about the best way to make the client do the magic. I knew that saharaclient did it and I missed the magic code in tempest - thanks!

The only difference that I see is that, when deploying with unversioned endopoints, the v1.1 calls related to plugins use the v2 format, without the project id:

    Response - Headers: {u'server': 'Apache/2.4.29 (Ubuntu)', 'content-location': 'http://10.209.32.62:8386/v1.1/plugins/cdh', u'content-length': '1660', u'date': 'Wed, 02 Jan 2019 23:23:30 GMT', u'content-type': 'application/json', u'x-openstack-request-id': 'req-447561a5-689e-46a7-8e21-c5f23c582d20', u'connection': 'close', 'status': '200'}

(see http://logs.openstack.org/30/622330/2/check/sahara-tests-tempest/36c5063/controller/logs/tempest_log.txt )
Is that expected, or am I misreading the logs?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-01-10 14:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Oh, well'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-10 15:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Deploying Sahara with unversioned endpoints

One of the tasks we need in order to make APIv2 is deployment with
unversioned endpoints.
This patch makes deployment of unversioned sahara when deployed with devstack

Depends-On: I5066f73aa0ace79d8d5e1431f8d741d0d942d9d5
Change-Id: I06ac6da0c6784680330ae0431c20d3553f95e452

[{'created': '2018-12-19 12:25:01.000000000', 'message': 'Allow plugin names to contain non-letter characters

There are already devstack plugins that contain a hyphen in the name,
like `networking-baremetal`. In order to allow ordering for these to
work properly, amend the regexes we are using to match any
non-whitespace characters instead of only alphanumerics.

Amend the test to cover this use case.

Change-Id: I91093a424f8d5e8007f140083e1ea36a81fe849f
Closes-Bug: 1809016

like `networking-baremetal`. In order to allow ordering for these to

commit_message:
Allow plugin names to contain non-letter characters

There are already devstack plugins that contain a hyphen in the name,
like `networking-baremetal`. In order to allow ordering for these to
work properly, amend the regexes we are using to match any
non-whitespace characters instead of only alphanumerics.

Amend the test to cover this use case.

Change-Id: I91093a424f8d5e8007f140083e1ea36a81fe849f
Closes-Bug: 1809016

commit_message:
Register Novacontrol role before Compute

During upgrades (from Queens to Rocky) of a topology containing Novacontrol
composable role, the roles file generated has Novacontrol succeeding Compute
role and hence the upgrade procedure fails on nova_wait_for_placement_service
container not able to start due to placement version (1.19) out of valid range
(1.0 to 1.17). Novacontrol needs to be upgraded before Compute node.

Change-Id: I81ed7b838fe39f04e46a5224faa8ca8f59e6fae8

commit_message:
Add PERCONA-PACKAGING-KEY

This patch adds /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/PERCONA-PACKAGING-KEY which
comes from installing [1] and is required in order to install
the percona packages on CentOS packages. Without it we get
the error:

Public key for percona-toolkit-3.0.13-1.el7.x86_64.rpm is not installed

We also rename RPM-GPG-KEY-percona to RPM-GPG-KEY-Percona in
order to match what is done by [1].

[1] https://repo.percona.com/yum/percona-release-latest.noarch.rpm

Change-Id: I2eeac8ea21c52fac3b1f32036fedcf7c62aac37f
(cherry picked from commit 6fdecd17b8e9fee6f6cacc4aaf1b478e73d2199f)

commit_message:
Default log location failes for non-root users

Any sub-command fails when executed as non-root user due to default
location being set to /var/log/paunch.log
Log location should be optional and specified by user.

Closes-bug: 1803421
Change-Id: I520add525efa7b7f959fb61aeb2053ef6a4085aa

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-12-20 13:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-12-20 13:54:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-01-04 16:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-01-04 16:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I updated the CinderVolume service name to use BlockStorageCinderVolume.

Are we also saying that the roles should be called BlockStorageCompute and BlockStorageComputeHCI instead of using the Distributed prefix?'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-01-04 16:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-01-04 20:51:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I want to ask again about glance. My understanding is the goal is having glance-api running at the edge, with local caching enabled. Then, when the nova (or cinder) services running at the Edge request an image, the local glance-api service will pull the image down from where it's store in the central site, but cache it locally. The idea is the first request will take a while to download over the Edge site's WAN, but subsequent requests will be served from the glance-api cache.

This is why I mentioned adding the GlanceApi service to these roles."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-01-07 09:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

lgtm, just small nit related to changes that just landed last week.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-01-07 21:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-01-07 22:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2019-01-08 11:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-01-09 19:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Can GlaceAPI be added to these new roles?'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-01-09 22:14:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Can GlaceAPI be added to these new roles?

What would that architecture look like? Haproxy with a VIP in the control stack routing requests to Glance api backends on the distributed computes?

Or would each Glance API expected to be it's own unique endpoint?

I'm not completely following how we'd configure that type of deployment. What are you thinking?"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2019-01-10 07:35:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> > Can GlaceAPI be added to these new roles?
 > 
 > What would that architecture look like? Haproxy with a VIP in the
 > control stack routing requests to Glance api backends on the
 > distributed computes?
 > 
 > Or would each Glance API expected to be it's own unique endpoint?

I think we can add this here or in a follow upbut, regardless, the idea is to have glance-api on a subset of the edge nodes (like it would be for the ceph-mon services), balanced with haproxy

we'd then need to configure nova-compute in the edge zone to point to the local glance-api endpint

in keystone we'll only have one glance endpoint though, referring to the instances running in the controlplane"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-01-10 12:31:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

> > > Can GlaceAPI be added to these new roles?
 > >
 > > What would that architecture look like? Haproxy with a VIP in the
 > > control stack routing requests to Glance api backends on the
 > > distributed computes?
 > >
 > > Or would each Glance API expected to be it's own unique endpoint?
 > 
 > I think we can add this here or in a follow upbut, regardless, the
 > idea is to have glance-api on a subset of the edge nodes (like it
 > would be for the ceph-mon services), balanced with haproxy
 > 
 > we'd then need to configure nova-compute in the edge zone to point
 > to the local glance-api endpint
 > 
 > in keystone we'll only have one glance endpoint though, referring
 > to the instances running in the controlplane

The benefit of this is that it would speed up image boot time. With glance-api running at the edge, with local caching enabled, when the nova services running at the Edge request an image, the local glance-api service will pull the image down from where it's stored in the central site, but cache it locally for the next instance of that image.

I +2'd this if you want to land it now and we can add it in a follow up."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-01-10 13:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Let's land this now, and consider GlanceApi in a followup patch.

The idea is you have a separate ha-proxy'ed set of glance-api services running at the edge, configured to use the same storage backend as the core. Because the edge and core share the same DB, the glance-api services running in the edge and core are functionally identical. The point of running them edge is to have them cache images that live in the backend storage in the core.

Now, to get cinder and nova services at the edge to use the edge's glance-api, we need the edge stack to reference the edge's glance-api service endpoint. In my PoC, I did this by filtering the glance service from the endpoint map "exported" from the core (see [1]). If you don't do that, and simply try to add another glance-api service, I recall (my memory is foggy) the edge deployment fails.

[1] https://gitlab.com/ASBishop/tripleo-standalone-edge/blob/master/create-compute-stack-env.sh#L20

So, I now think we should *not* add GlanceApi at the edge until we coordinate other activities (such as updating the edge deployment docs).'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2019-01-10 13:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

+1 for omitting glance api cache for now. I expect we will need another set of roles for the edge nodes running it. Similar for the nova cell services. The permutations could get unwieldy though.'}]

commit_message:
Add Distributed Compute roles

Adds new roles for DistributedCompute and DistributedComputeHCI. These
roles closely match the existing Compute roles but also include the
CinderVolume service.

implements split-controlplane

Change-Id: Ia7f5ba93a9fc31b4653e6cbd9b3e5d8f00d26a27
