(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-26 22:19:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Okay, I need to look at this a little closer, but can you clarify the purpose of this change? It seems a bit invasive to just fix both the new and old values being selected for opts with choices. It's also not clear to me under what circumstances that would happen since the tests seemed to suggest that only the new value is used.

This also looks like an optimization refactoring, which would ideally be split into a separate change from the bug fix since it's a major change to the code that makes the review more confusing."}, {'account_id': 28278, 'date': '2018-10-30 11:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 28278, 'date': '2018-10-30 11:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(3 comments)

I've added 2 unit-tests to clarify the purpose of this change. I hope it makes sense to you."}, {'account_id': 28278, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 28278, 'date': '2018-11-02 08:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28278, 'date': '2018-11-05 03:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 28278, 'date': '2018-11-05 03:57:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 28278, 'date': '2018-11-05 13:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28278, 'date': '2018-11-08 07:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Patch Set 13 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 28278, 'date': '2018-11-08 09:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-08 20:11:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Okay, I think I understand this now. I ran the tests without the fix and get http://paste.openstack.org/show/734441/ which (in case that expires) is a ConfigFileValueError because the old value from the config file is no longer valid in the new config opt.

So, with that in mind I have a couple of comments on the implementation of the fix, but I also have one important question: Is this even a valid migration path?

In other words, is it even valid for a project to change its option choices without a deprecation period?  For example, let's say a project was using full module paths to a driver ('module.submodule.drivername') and decides to add smart lookup such that just 'drivername' can be used instead. Is it acceptable for them to change their choices from ['module.submodule.drivername'] to ['drivername'] in one cycle without a deprecation period for 'module.submodule.drivername'?

I'm kind of inclined to say no. That said, I'm pretty sure such changes _have_ happened in the past, so it may be something we want to support anyway. I'm interested in getting some other perspectives on this. Maybe we want a mailing list discussion?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-12-13 15:54:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-12-13 16:14:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-12-13 16:28:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-01-10 15:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning per the discussion in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-January/001580.html

If you have further interest in developing this feature please contact the Oslo team.'}]

commit_message:
update valid value in choice list for the opt

Instead of selecting both old value and new value in the
choice list only the new value should be selected.

commit_message:
update 'sample_default' instead of 'default' when migrating

The migration needs to update the sample default instead of the
default because the sample takes precedence in the output generator.

Change-Id: I6a769b37efb6fb6a61c67aaa54369fcf2cf9500d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
use difflib to report mismatches in migrator tests

Rather than just dumping the text, which is long and hard to parse for
differences, use difflib to show how the two blocks of text are
different.

Change-Id: I82570fda86d29c3637786ab41482d6409d0b857e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
replace 'upgrade_value' with 'convert_on_upgrade'

Rather than assuming all configuration values can be swapped with a
simple mapping, use a callable to convert the value from old to
new.

Change-Id: I53a7f0a7e5fd20ab69953eca19dfef577d328236
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

(1 comment)

I believe a lot of the option processing being done here is already handled by the machine readable config generator.  This is exactly the sort of problem that was written to address, so I would prefer to reuse as much of it as possible.

Note that the machine readable sample config already includes a mapping of deprecated options in both directions, so you can either find the deprecated version of a new opt or the new name for a deprecated opt.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-02-09 04:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

A couple of comments on the old patch set.  It's going to be a little tricky to review the updates since the filename changed and we can't just diff it. :-/"}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-07 02:38:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

Thanks, 

i very like the name which you suggested to me so i changed the file name, it made you feel a little difficult reviewing. Sorry for that :)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-08 19:48:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Some further comments inline.

I'm also concerned that there seem to be a number of missing options in the post-migration Cinder example.  For example, the entire lvmdriver-1 group seems to have disappeared, and many of the nova section options are missing.  There may be others, but those two jumped out at me.

Which actually brings up the point that we will need unit tests for this code, just like we have for the config generator.  It's complex enough that there's a good chance we'll break things as we iterate on it in the future if we don't have solid testing of the functionality.  That would make it somewhat easier to review too because reviewers wouldn't have to review for correctness since the tests would demonstrate that."}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-11 09:04:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-05-11 09:24:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1449136 https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1326813

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-15 16:56:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-15 16:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Workflow-1

(7 comments)

Thanks for your comment, I am updating this patch. And I will answer all of your comment again after finishing.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-17 07:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-17 07:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19: Patch Set 18 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-17 09:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

Hi Ben,

I've just updated a new patch set with some unit-tests. For now, I would like to answer your last comments.

> I'm also concerned that there seem to be a number of missing options in the post-migration Cinder example.  For example, the entire lvmdriver-1 group seems to have disappeared, and many of the nova section options are missing.  There may be others, but those two jumped out at me.

Yes, you are right. Because:
1. There are some options in Cinder that are dynamic section so it did not load the options.
2. The old config is generated by Devstack so there are some options which was not declared right. For example, in nova section, there are no "region_name", "memcached_servers",...

> Which actually brings up the point that we will need unit tests for this code, just like we have for the config generator.  It's complex enough that there's a good chance we'll break things as we iterate on it in the future if we don't have solid testing of the functionality.  That would make it somewhat easier to review too because reviewers wouldn't have to review for correctness since the tests would demonstrate that.

Yeah, there are 6 unit-test currently, I will continue to update more unit-tests. It would be great if you review it.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-17 09:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-18 03:17:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 23630, 'date': '2018-05-18 08:19:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

Hi Tovin, I will update all your comments surely in near future.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-24 09:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-24 09:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-05-28 03:26:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

Hi Ben,

I updated a patch set with some changes.

1. There are some unit-tests, (i will update more unit-test if necessary)

2. There is a trick that i'm using. When I get real values for each option then i will update it to the value of own option instead of getting from the temporary config file as the previous method.

So I think it is ready for review. Could you help me to do this?"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-08 17:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

Okay, I have some concerns with this still.  I haven't gotten through the whole new method, although the unit tests do look promising so thanks for writing those.

I'm going to propose for the moment that you remove the help option and just always write the help to the output file.  It's simple enough to strip comments if someone really wants a minimal config file.  I would also suggest removing the "wrong opts" code as I don't think we want to persist those.  When I asked about the Cinder opts I wasn't aware that some of them were non-existent.

I haven't had a chance to look at how we should deal with the global variables though, which are my biggest concern right now.  Maybe leave that alone for now and I'll come back to it next week and see if I can suggest something else.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-06-11 08:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-06-11 08:23:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

(6 comments)

Hello Ben,

Thanks for your comment, I've just updated a new patch set as your comment. Summary, there are some changed as following:

+ Removed the help option
+ Used a class to store all variables config instead of making global variables.
+ Explained the append_wrong_opts function.

Please see my reply comment inline for more detail."}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-06-18 07:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-07-04 14:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-06 22:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review-1

(16 comments)

Okay, this is looking very good now.  A number of my inline comments are just nits that could be dealt with in a followup, but there are a few things I think we should address before this merges.

Thanks for your patience and I will try to be more punctual in responding from now on.'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2018-07-11 16:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

(16 comments)

Hello Ben,

Thanks for your comments, it is very detailed.

Most of them, I agree with you. There is only one point on the generator.py file that I would like to discuss with you. Please check it.

Btw, all reply comments I mask done. It means I already updated on my local. It will be updated in the next patch.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-11 21:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-27 14:24:02.000000000', 'message': "Set non-0 disk sizes for tempest flavors

Nova change https://review.openstack.org/603910/ is
going to change the default rule on policy
os_compute_api:servers:create:zero_disk_flavor to
admin-only, which will prevent non-admins from
creating image-backed servers with a flavor that
has disk=0 since it's a potential security exposure.

Therefore we need the test flavors that are created
for tempest to use non-0 disk values. Since the flavor_ref
and flavor_ref_alt can be aligned to the image_ref and
image_ref_alt in tempest.conf, we get the image sizes
from glance (in bytes) and convert those to GiB disk
sizes for each flavor, respectively. Since we're using
Cirros images by default, we need to make sure to round
up otherwise we'd still have a 0-disk flavor.

There are lots of ways the math could be done here
using numfmt, bash, awk, bc, etc, but it's simplest to
write and probably easiest to read by using python for
the size conversion code.

Change-Id: I537c299b0cd400982189f35b31df74755422737e
Related-Bug: #1739646
(cherry picked from commit 23d33a8b5bc945bd98c8fffe86b38f97247afbd9)
"}]
commit_message:
Set non-0 disk sizes for tempest flavors

Nova change https://review.openstack.org/603910/ is
going to change the default rule on policy
os_compute_api:servers:create:zero_disk_flavor to
admin-only, which will prevent non-admins from
creating image-backed servers with a flavor that
has disk=0 since it's a potential security exposure.

Therefore we need the test flavors that are created
for tempest to use non-0 disk values. Since the flavor_ref
and flavor_ref_alt can be aligned to the image_ref and
image_ref_alt in tempest.conf, we get the image sizes
from glance (in bytes) and convert those to GiB disk
sizes for each flavor, respectively. Since we're using
Cirros images by default, we need to make sure to round
up otherwise we'd still have a 0-disk flavor.

There are lots of ways the math could be done here
using numfmt, bash, awk, bc, etc, but it's simplest to
write and probably easiest to read by using python for
the size conversion code.

Change-Id: I537c299b0cd400982189f35b31df74755422737e
Related-Bug: #1739646
(cherry picked from commit 23d33a8b5bc945bd98c8fffe86b38f97247afbd9)

commit_message:
Upgrade python-paunch before undercloud upgrade.

We need to upgrade python-paunch before running the undercloud
upgrade, otherwise the undercloud fails with an AttributeError:
'module' object has no attribute 'PodmanRunner'

Change-Id: Iac7c49521c167b321cf2ffd717b9dcb502fe4364
Closes-Bug: #1811092

Change-Id: I2eeac8ea21c52fac3b1f32036fedcf7c62aac37f

commit_message:
Add PERCONA-PACKAGING-KEY

This patch adds /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/PERCONA-PACKAGING-KEY which
comes from installing [1] and is required in order to install
the percona packages on CentOS packages. Without it we get
the error:

Public key for percona-toolkit-3.0.13-1.el7.x86_64.rpm is not installed

We also rename RPM-GPG-KEY-percona to RPM-GPG-KEY-Percona in
order to match what is done by [1].

[1] https://repo.percona.com/yum/percona-release-latest.noarch.rpm

Change-Id: I2eeac8ea21c52fac3b1f32036fedcf7c62aac37f

subject: Ensure /var/lib/iscsi actually exists before mounting it
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-01-08 10:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-01-08 10:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-01-08 11:44:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-01-08 11:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-01-08 13:05:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Good catch, thanks! When I tested my patch the directory *did* exists, and I overlooked scenarios (perhaps a deployed server?) where it might not exist.

Please add "Related-Bug: #1810338" to the commit message, and I'll add my +2. I need to backport my patch (and so I'll include yours as well), and it will help if this patch references a bug.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-08 13:36:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-08 15:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-01-08 15:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-08 16:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-08 17:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-01-08 21:01:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Let's start with the problem described in the LP bug. If iscsi-initiator-utils is installed, then it will add an iscsi-shutdown systemd service that logs out all connections on system shutdown. As the LP explains, this will hang when nova has instances that are stopped, and nova's iSCSI connections aren't known to the host. The bind mount makes nova's connections visible on the host.

However, iscsi-initiator-utils is not always installed. It seems to be installed on the common overcloud image, but may not be installed on the undercloud, a deployed server, or on a standalone node.

This leaves us in an awkward situation. If iscsi-initiator-utils is installed on the host, we need the bind mount so that the host can disconnect everything on shutdown.  But if iscsi-initiator-utils is NOT installed on the host, the bind mount isn't necessary because the host won't have the iscsi-shutdown service trying to do things on shutdown.

I suppose the bind mount could be made conditional on whether iscsi-initiator-utils is installed on the host. But that's messy, and the logic would need to be repeated in each of the affected container's THT file.

Given the tradeoffs, I'm leaning toward creating the directory as Cedric originally coded it.
- This will not do anything if iscsi-initiator-utils is already installed on the host.
- It will allow the bind mounts to succeed when iscsi-initiator-utils is *not* installed on the host. The bind mounts won't really be necessary, but creating the directory avoids making the bind mounts conditional.

I'd like to see a Related-Bug reference in the commit message."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-08 21:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

So the problem I see is that if iscsi-initiator-utils is in the container and not on the host, the mount from the previous patch will mask the installed items in /var/lib/iscsi.  Not necessarily related to this patch, but there is an issue in general here around this.  If the masking of the folders provided via iscsi-initiator-utils is not a problem then we can proceed with this then.  So yea I guess we just need a bug reported'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-01-08 22:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

fwiw, I just finished a very quick test that suggests the iscsi stuff running in a container can recreate the subdirectories under /var/lib/iscsi. I tested a standalone deployment with iscsi-initiator-utils *not* installed, but /var/lib/iscsi present (manually created prior to deployment). I am able to boot a nova instance and attach a cinder volume, and see the /var/lib/iscsi/nodes directory was created and populated with nova's connection info.

[stack@standalone ~]$ sudo docker exec -ti -u root nova_compute find /var/lib/iscsi                                                            
/var/lib/iscsi
/var/lib/iscsi/nodes
/var/lib/iscsi/nodes/iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-0b6d4b91-f9bb-4d7d-aefc-68bffef04df2
/var/lib/iscsi/nodes/iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-0b6d4b91-f9bb-4d7d-aefc-68bffef04df2/192.168.24.2,3260

[stack@standalone ~]$ sudo docker exec -ti -u root nova_compute iscsiadm -m session                                                           
tcp: [1] 192.168.24.2:3260,1 iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-0b6d4b91-f9bb-4d7d-aefc-68bffef04df2 (non-flash)

[stack@standalone ~]$ sudo docker exec -ti -u root nova_compute iscsiadm -m node
192.168.24.2:3260,-1 iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-0b6d4b91-f9bb-4d7d-aefc-68bffef04df2

The data is visible on the host (even though it doesn't need it)

[stack@standalone ~]$ sudo find /var/lib/iscsi/
/var/lib/iscsi/
/var/lib/iscsi/nodes
/var/lib/iscsi/nodes/iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-0b6d4b91-f9bb-4d7d-aefc-68bffef04df2
/var/lib/iscsi/nodes/iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-0b6d4b91-f9bb-4d7d-aefc-68bffef04df2/192.168.24.2,3260

Not sure how to know if the other /var/lib/iscsi subdirs will behave the same."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-01-09 05:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-01-09 08:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck

an old friend knocked on the door:
2019-01-09 06:27:16,352 ERROR: 23746 -- unable to find user root: no matching entries in passwd file",'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-01-09 10:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Ensure /var/lib/iscsi actually exists before mounting it

Change I803ed2ba9ff52f9a02c550a28d21cc9102568c8e adds this directory
as bind-mount for many services, but there is no guarantee this directory
actually exists on the node.

This might break the deploy, as it will prevent the iscsi container to
start as expected when using podman.

Although this directory is managed by a package (iscsi-initiator-utils),
this one isn't always present (i.e. on undercloud, or deployed servers,
or standalone).

Related-Bug: #1810338
Change-Id: I8fc52b2a872fd77b342a0f20e4602b21d9e33fed

commit_message:
Make sure nova-compute is not configured with database access

Apparently we're inheriting some database config from the main file,
which should not be set for nova-compute. If we're properly in superconductor
mode where we have a dedicated config for compute, remove those lines
if present.

Closes-Bug: #1797413

Change-Id: I4820abe57a023050dd8d067c77e26028801ff288
(cherry picked from commit 7d0003ef7ed2c2609ffe6782e0ce6147f9c9a3bf)

commit_message:
Fix ansible lint errors

The gate is now using the last ansible-lint version (4.0.1) which have new
ids/tags and new rules. The old tags (ANSIBLE*) should remains backwardly
compatible but this patch is using the new ones.

This patch fixes all the lint issues.

Change-Id: Ic151f3e969b8e3729394fd477bb8341d1cb75fd7
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Do not install pip in amphora when using distribution packages

pip-and-virtualenv element is not needed in that case, and can cause
image build failures in environments without direct Internet access

Change-Id: I37616d76dd78ffb1419a898509e9466e7c54f69f

commit_message:
Add Fix django.contrib.auth.middleware monkey patching for APITestCase

This patch rollbacks changes in APITestCase introduced in the
0d163613265e036818fe567793a4fc88fe140d4a commit to unblock Horizon
plugins gates.

Conflicts:
        openstack_dashboard/test/helpers.py

Note(elod.illes): the above mentioned change in APITestCase was
backported to queens, so this rollback should be backported, too.

Change-Id: I6b2be31568e4aa4273990f9cfa76ca139620c84b
Closes-bug: #1806053
Closes-bug: #1805240
(cherry picked from commit de69edd0402146d76c65cec6cc7879c71259fbbf)
(cherry picked from commit 85fef71c0dfff3b7f816add638ad2d916a2ffe38)

commit_message:
Migrate linting to pre-commit

Follows the same linting configuration that was implemented first in
tripleo-quickstart-extras which makes used of pre-commit tool for
managing all linters.

This also avoids problems where a new linter release may break our
gates because pre-commit always pins versions.

Removes ansible from requirements.txt as it needs to be listed only
in ansible-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ia229d3d58763d743bd19ad9099d7907561f3c77f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627186/
(cherry picked from commit 8ac74a817704ca50674e6beaa91b792f62660942)

The error was caused by skopeo missing on the scaled out node and I think this is caused by running the 'openshift_prerequisites_playbook_path' playbook only during the initial stack creation."}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-05 09:37:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > The error was caused by skopeo missing on the scaled out node and I
 > think this is caused by running the 'openshift_prerequisites_playbook_path'
 > playbook only during the initial stack creation.

The prerequisites.yml playbook is normally called by the openshift-node/scaleup.yml and openshift-master/scaleup.yml only on the scaled out nodes:

https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/blob/master/playbooks/openshift-node/scaleup.yml#L27
https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/blob/master/playbooks/openshift-master/scaleup.yml#L32

http://paste.openstack.org/show/736715/'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-06 12:53:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Possibly a new regression as it seems similar to what's observed in https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1622945"}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-06 19:48:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

 > https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1622945

Just a side note: I managed to scale out successfully on an environment installed manually with openshift-ansible - openshift-ansible-3.11.51-1.git.0.51c90a3.el7.noarch"}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-06 22:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

OK, I found the issue, to summarize - the master nodes cannot resolve the name of the scaled out node even if it has entries in /etc/hosts - http://paste.openstack.org/show/736796/

In order to make it work we need to restart dnsmasq on master nodes so it takes into consideration the newly added entries in /etc/hosts for the scaled out node:

[root@openshift-master-0 heat-admin]# dig +short @10.0.0.108 openshift-worker-3
[root@openshift-master-0 heat-admin]# 
[root@openshift-master-0 heat-admin]# systemctl restart dnsmasq
[root@openshift-master-0 heat-admin]# dig +short @10.0.0.108 openshift-worker-3


After this - TASK [Approve node certificates when bootstrapping] successfuly run.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-07 02:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-07 07:10:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

 > /etc/hosts - http://paste.openstack.org/show/736796/
 
Marius, what a great feeling to wake up in the morning and find that you've identified the issue that was blocking me. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-07 07:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-07 07:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-12-07 22:16:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

The `prerequisites.yml` playbook should only be explicitly run on
initial deployment to prepare the nodes. It is already included in the
scaleup playbooks for the new nodes so there is no need to include it
again. Re-running the `prerequisites.yml` playbook reconfigures the
container runtime and may cause outage, it is supposed to be run only
once.

Make update and upgrade playbooks exclusive. There is no need to run
both of them.

Add comments to clarify the intent for each playbooks.

Closes-Bug: #1804790

commit_message:
Rework the generated openshift-ansible playbook

The `prerequisites.yml` playbook should only be explicitly run on
initial deployment to prepare the nodes. It is already included in the
scaleup playbooks for the new nodes so there is no need to include it
again. Re-running the `prerequisites.yml` playbook reconfigures the
container runtime and may cause outage, it is supposed to be run only
once.

Make update and upgrade playbooks exclusive. There is no need to run
both of them.

Add comments to clarify the intent for each playbooks.

Change-Id: I30278360fcc1ffa9bd7ce7cb77d023629fb6fa47
Closes-Bug: #1804790

take this IP as the service IP

'}, {'created': '2019-01-03 12:40:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add a cloud provider config option

In case cloud provider is not configured,  Openshift will allocate an
external IP and overwrite status/ingress/IP set by Kuryr-controller.
This patch updates the get_service_ip function, to retrieve the service
external IP based on whether cloud provider is set or not.

Change-Id: I07a771bba7f218ea04c4c4de1dce29ec8c7c9e2f

commit_message:
Add a cloud provider config option

In case cloud provider is not configured,  Openshift will allocate an
external IP and overwrite status/ingress/IP set by Kuryr-controller.
This patch updates the get_service_ip function, to retrieve the service
external IP based on whether cloud provider is set or not.

Change-Id: I07a771bba7f218ea04c4c4de1dce29ec8c7c9e2f
Depends-On: Iaff9a1f4d3d8972b3e042f5e7b1d3d9c08fe9fc5

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2018-12-18 13:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello Jens, thank you for your comment.

If the original is correct, then the definition is wrong.

The definition says: "It should generally be the last component of the git repo path (e.g., if the plugin’s repo is openstack/devstack-foo, then the name here should be “foo”)".

In this case the last component of the repo path is not "foo" but "devstack-foo".'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2018-12-18 16:07:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27078, 'date': '2018-12-19 06:52:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

[{'created': '2018-12-18 10:22:47.000000000', 'message': "Correcting typo in plugins section

Fixing the example of the plugin's name as the last component
of the git repo path that uses a minus instead of a slash.

Change-Id: I2f12d4d26993ec192517de7f5541c4219ee59ed9
"}, {'created': '2018-12-18 16:07:12.000000000', 'message': "Correcting typo in plugins section

Fixing the example of the plugin's name as the last component
of the git repo path should be foo.

Change-Id: I2f12d4d26993ec192517de7f5541c4219ee59ed9
"}]
commit_message:
Correcting typo in plugins section

Fixing the example of the plugin's name as the last component
of the git repo path should be foo.

Change-Id: I2f12d4d26993ec192517de7f5541c4219ee59ed9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-21 14:23:12.000000000', 'message': 'Remove port 35357 deployment

The legacy admin and public ports for Keystone has since the
release of the v3 API not been required as keystone moved all
actions to the same API. [1]

This patch removes the deployment of port 35357 and remodels
puppet-keystone and more specifically the keystone::wsgi::apache
class to only deploy keystone on port 5000.

This has already been changed in the installation guides [2]
and is the recommend way to deploy keystone.

We have already prepared all our modules default values to use
port 5000 instead of 35357 a while ago and we also in the Rocky
release informed our users with a release note that this would
be performed [3]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/server/wsgi.py
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/rocky/install/keystone-install-obs.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586791/

Change-Id: I726cd9408d20f868b2b5337ef2df4da458904e51

commit_message:
Remove port 35357 deployment

The legacy admin and public ports for Keystone has since the
release of the v3 API not been required as keystone moved all
actions to the same API. [1]

This patch removes the deployment of port 35357 and remodels
puppet-keystone and more specifically the keystone::wsgi::apache
class to only deploy keystone on port 5000.

This has already been changed in the installation guides [2]
and is the recommend way to deploy keystone.

We have already prepared all our modules default values to use
port 5000 instead of 35357 a while ago and we also in the Rocky
release informed our users with a release note that this would
be performed [3]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/server/wsgi.py
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/rocky/install/keystone-install-obs.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586791/

Closes-Bug: 1804426
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627793/
Change-Id: I726cd9408d20f868b2b5337ef2df4da458904e51

commit_message:
Revert "Add keystone::wsgi::apache::api_port"

Until we provide a proper fix, let's revert this patch which broke TripleO when network isolation is enabled.

This reverts commit 105ae9db35c2469eb977606977d09c6c0a040759.
Related-Bug: #1811185

Change-Id: Id46905f21df45bd7c20240d81b87e86858fa0950

commit_message:
Add keystone::wsgi::apache::api_port

This will be the parameter controlling the ports
for the Keystone WSGI vhost in Apache when this [1]
rework is done.

This is to make sure Keystone is still deployed
with both ports in TripleO until it's moved over.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619257/

Change-Id: I1c69b27adf450489290a9f8b64f533de1cb28d8b

commit_message:
Stop using setup.py build_sphinx

This is deprecated in pbr and the preferred way to do doc builds now
is to use sphinx-build directly.

Change-Id: Id5081ffb9f5b5e6ce608d2f10e9ef89a8b40eeed

[{'created': '2019-01-09 08:34:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix comparing dictionaries for changes detection

Non-unicode and unicode dicts cannot be compared.

rebuilding containers w/o a need.

commit_message:
Fix comparing dictionaries for changes detection

Non-unicode and unicode dicts cannot be compared.
That makes paunch failing to detect config changes and
rebuilding containers w/o a need.

Change-Id: Ie2db16b982bf1851ab37c3514c1bc82cfc64d0b3
Closes-Bug: #1810690
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

(12 comments)

OK, despite my skepticism around the Contrail stuff, I'm generally supportive of this effort to standardize the vRouter VIF plugin implementations, so ++ on that.

I would, however, like you to include some more links to the existing legacy codebase and os-vif plugin for the contrail_vrouter stuff and consider changing the object modeling for the VFRepresentor stuff to use a composition technique instead of an inheritance technique for modeling the VF representor information in the port profiles. (see inline)

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-06-07 08:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2018-05-09 08:22:14.000000000', 'message': 'Spec to implement vRouter HW offloads

SmartNICs allow complex packet processing on the NIC. In order to support
hardware acceleration for them, Nova core needs modifications to support the
combination of VIF and vRouter plugging they support. This spec proposes a
hybrid SR-IOV and vRouter model to enable acceleration.

Change-Id: If4c2795d33dbd701582bfb8ea5aa4b14f4e69341
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

commit_message:
Spec to implement vRouter HW offloads

SmartNICs allow complex packet processing on the NIC. In order to
support hardware acceleration for them, Nova core needs modifications
to support the combination of VIF and vRouter plugging they support.
This spec proposes a hybrid SR-IOV and vRouter model to enable
acceleration.

Change-Id: If4c2795d33dbd701582bfb8ea5aa4b14f4e69341
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
blueprint: vrouter-hw-offloads

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-06 21:35:48.000000000', 'message': 'build: treat names from profile/shell like beginning of names

When Kolla is run user can give a list of images to build or use
--config-file + --profile options to give predefined list of images.

Those names are matches against names of available images and queue is
built.

So user can say "kolla [options] cinder" and will get 'cinder' and all
it's dependencies built.

The problem starts with 'monasca-grafana' image which is built when
'grafana' is requested (as it match regexp). And it fails on Debian due
to lack of 'npm' package.

So solution is to treat names from profile/shell not as words but as
beginning of lines so when 'cinder grafana' is given it matches all
'cinder.*' images and 'grafana.*' images but not '.*cinder.*' nor
'.*grafana.*' ones.

Change-Id: Ic32d54413ad12326beeb54aa369910169c45e74a
'}]
commit_message:
build: treat names from profile/shell like beginning of names

When Kolla is run user can give a list of images to build or use
--config-file + --profile options to give predefined list of images.

Those names are matches against names of available images and queue is
built.

So user can say "kolla [options] cinder" and will get 'cinder' and all
it's dependencies built.

The problem starts with 'monasca-grafana' image which is built when
'grafana' is requested (as it match regexp). And it fails on Debian due
to lack of 'npm' package.

So solution is to treat names from profile/shell not as words but as
beginning of lines so when 'cinder grafana' is given it matches all
'cinder.*' images and 'grafana.*' images but not '.*cinder.*' nor
'.*grafana.*' ones.

Change-Id: Ic32d54413ad12326beeb54aa369910169c45e74a

commit_message:
sahara: basic jobs for the new repos, fix IRC notifications

- add only the publish-to-pypi job for now, and set the jobs to use
  the sahara queue.
- fix the regexp used for IRC notifications on changes to
  sahara-related repositories.

Change-Id: I4ecc1947501223bafa08cd23288636b701c3494a

commit_message:
Add support to all Scenarios to work with Fedora and RedHat > 7

Disable SSL as currently there are known issues in services
to work with python3 + SSL on Fedora.

Also fixed following:-
- watcher to work without SSL
- Handle source /etc/bashrc for users don't have .bashrc created
- Install python3-rbd in Fedora and RedHat > 7

Change-Id: I5b67f40ec3c687f5282c65e10b4a1ee1fe5528f3

commit_message:
Fix XStatic dependencies

These XStatic-* packages are currently uninstallable because the python2
versions of the packages are depending python3 versions of XStatic. Fix
the runtime dependencies to be version agnostic.

Change-Id: I388935443f573e10f85d3ccdf0988cf70aa29522
(cherry picked from commit 2901c0f523dfef81d990bd2057c1c1449bad7b3a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-10 14:56:24.000000000', 'message': 'Do not dump all instances in the scheduler

There is a log message in the scheduler which dumps all instances
running on a compute host. There are at least 2 problems with this:
1. it generates huge amount of logs which are not really useful
2. it crashes when there is an instance with non-ascii name

Instead of fixing 2), just print instance UUIDs.

Closes-Bug: #1790126
Related-Bug: #1620692
Change-Id: I0eda1c58a7eb54121230c880818b4b1d0fdf4893
(cherry picked from commit 4fd7c93726eff4cc0b010741ea1772cf19c314fc)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not dump all instances in the scheduler

There is a log message in the scheduler which dumps all instances
running on a compute host. There are at least 2 problems with this:
1. it generates huge amount of logs which are not really useful
2. it crashes when there is an instance with non-ascii name

Instead of fixing 2), just print instance UUIDs.

Closes-Bug: #1790126
Related-Bug: #1620692
Change-Id: I0eda1c58a7eb54121230c880818b4b1d0fdf4893
(cherry picked from commit 4fd7c93726eff4cc0b010741ea1772cf19c314fc)

subject: Make the Perl smarter, remove the double payload
messages: [{'account_id': 28376, 'date': '2019-01-10 09:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28376, 'date': '2019-01-10 09:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nThis was supposed to update review 626598.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-10 09:54:11.000000000', 'message': 'Make the Perl smarter, remove the double payload

It's surprisingly tricky to accomplish Python's "import foo as bar" in
Perl without adding extra dependencies. The latest commit improves the
Perl code to use Monitoring::Plugin if available, and fall back to
Nagios::Plugin if not.

There is a little repetition in the two approaches, but I felt this was
less-bad than adding an additional dependency such as Package::Alias for
the sake of a few lines (it would also need packaging).

Also added quotation marks to some barewords to make the parser happy.

Change-Id: I9ee474a5baaca86a4e3e1b57cc247328c2c6ca93
'}]
commit_message:
Make the Perl smarter, remove the double payload

It's surprisingly tricky to accomplish Python's "import foo as bar" in
Perl without adding extra dependencies. The latest commit improves the
Perl code to use Monitoring::Plugin if available, and fall back to
Nagios::Plugin if not.

There is a little repetition in the two approaches, but I felt this was
less-bad than adding an additional dependency such as Package::Alias for
the sake of a few lines (it would also need packaging).

Also added quotation marks to some barewords to make the parser happy.

Change-Id: I9ee474a5baaca86a4e3e1b57cc247328c2c6ca93

commit_message:
Add possibility to have private cinder volume types

When declaring cinder_backends in user_variables.yml, it
will create public volume types.

We should be able to add an option to set the volume type
as private. This commit add this possibility.

Change-Id: I583ad08feb2293b14da8d6ccd42f8809f1f45b8d
Related-Bug: 1804438

commit_message:
Enable image inject metadata properties & user roles to be ignored

Adding inject_metadata_properties & ignore_user_roles params to
inject metadata properties to the image with specific user roles
to be ignored for injecting metadata properties in the image..

Ref: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/inject-automatic-metadata

Change-Id: I02482dff7b1412d6254ce82d80257ce26c23430d

subject: Add wsrep-slave-threads and gcs-fc-limit
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 13686, 'name': 'Frode Nordahl', 'email': 'frode.nordahl@canonical.com', 'username': 'fnordahl'}, {'_account_id': 20634, 'name': 'Chris MacNaughton', 'email': 'chris.macnaughton@canonical.com', 'username': 'Chris.MacNaughton'}, {'_account_id': 20635, 'name': 'Ryan Beisner', 'email': 'ryanbeisner@gmail.com', 'username': 'ryan-beisner'}, {'_account_id': 20648, 'name': 'Canonical CI', 'email': 'uosci-testing-bot@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'uosci-testing-bot', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21107, 'name': 'Trent Lloyd', 'email': 'trent.lloyd@canonical.com', 'username': 'lathiat'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2018-10-24 03:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2018-10-24 03:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2018-11-02 07:19:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There is no functional testing of this change, as the defaults in the configuration are None, and there are no changes to the tested configurations in the Amulet testing.

Also, is there any reason why you would _not_ want to increase the wsrep_threads? If the default should be more than one, I'd prefer to make the default be that. One of the designs of the openstack-charms is to be opinionated so that the default setup is the optimal setup, as much as possible."}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2018-11-02 18:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thank you for your work on this.

I think this is worth a conversation across the openstack charms+arch groups, as this is an opportunity to potentially improve the default behavior.


To summarize Chris's items, an add my thoughts:


1. Is the default slave thread count value of 1 OK for general use as the charm default?  Is there benefit in being more opinionated with a higher default value?

Related reading and recommendations: http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/mysqlwsrepoptions.html#wsrep-slave-threads


2. I have the same type of question for flow control.  Is the default 16 OK for general use, or is there benefit to a higher default value?

Related reading and recommendations:  "BEWARE: Increasing fc_limit can affect SELECT latency"
https://www.percona.com/blog/2017/04/22/beware-increasing-fc_limit-can-affect-select-latency/


3. There is unit test coverage proposed for one of the two new config options.  We need to cover both for value validation and regression prevention.


4. Functional tests.  Granted: the openstack charms are in a state of transition on the topic of func test framework (heading to Zaza from Amulet).  As a minimal-effort but still-useful func test, I'd suggest the following coverage in the existing basic_deployment.py suite:

Set the two new config options to 2 and 32, respectively:

https://github.com/openstack/charm-percona-cluster/blob/master/tests/basic_deployment.py#L73

While this alone doesn't actually inspect and confirm the values, it ensures that the rendered configuration values do not cause pxc to error, and that's a useful blackbox sort of func test.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2018-11-08 03:50:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Opinions from the wider audience are absent so far on any sort of change in the default behavior, which I'm also OK with.  ie. Just continue to defer to the payload (percona-xtradb-cluster) defaults on the matter, while exposing the option as a configurable.

With that, work can and should continue to address the identified unit and func test gaps.

Thanks again!"}, {'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2018-11-14 09:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> 1. Is the default slave thread count value of 1 OK for general use as the charm default?  Is there benefit in being more opinionated with a higher default value?
> Related reading and recommendations: http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/mysqlwsrepoptions.html#wsrep-slave-threads

The only concern I would have moving from the default (1) to a higher value is that there does unfortunately seem to be some bugs in Percona 5.6 that won't get fixed (as it's no longer maintained upstream) that sometimes cause replication failures when replicating with multiple threads.

Specifically this seems to happen when you have foreign keys (which openstack does).. sometimes it ends up violating the foreign key constraints on the slave by accident.. this seems fixed in Percona 5.7 (Bionic) but won't go away in Percona 5.6 (Xenial).

It's not the most major issue, in that, the impact is for the slave servers to restart and SST from the master again (the master does not go down) but it is a bit of a pain never the less.

Leaving the current values having no default is good in that it potentially gives us scope to set a per-version default when it's not specified by the user.

> 2. I have the same type of question for flow control.  Is the default 16 OK for general use, or is there benefit to a higher default value?
> 
> Related reading and recommendations:  "BEWARE: Increasing fc_limit can affect SELECT latency"
https://www.percona.com/blog/2017/04/22/beware-increasing-fc_limit-can-affect-select-latency/

There is no concern with raising fc_limit in our specific situation, because we only ever read/write from a single server right now. The impacts of changing this variable only come into play when you are trying to read/write from multiple servers.



+1 on this change from me'}, {'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2018-12-17 03:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10086, 'date': '2018-12-17 05:08:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-09 09:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-10 06:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-01-10 09:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM, thanks!'}]

commit_message:
Add wsrep-slave-threads and gcs-fc-limit

These options allow tuning the Galera replication to avoid flow control from
slowing down the primary.

Change-Id: Ib275cae0db02e4c8c0a85fcc8cb138b26eb26982
Closes-Bug: 1799622

commit_message:
Fix XStatic dependencies

These XStatic-* packages are currently uninstallable because the python2
versions of the packages are depending python3 versions of XStatic. Fix
the runtime dependencies to be version agnostic.

Change-Id: I388935443f573e10f85d3ccdf0988cf70aa29522

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 08:29:35.000000000', 'message': 'Doc: Update Kolla Ceph document for mixed Ceph OSD deployment

Since Rocky release Kolla Ceph supports both bluestore and
filestore Ceph OSD. In multinode mode, users can overwrite
“ceph_osd_store_type” in the inventory file and deploy the mixed
Ceph OSD.

Change-Id: I4582861c81fdea5fb67114cf3ac1e48f7812f0d7
Signed-off-by: tone.zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Doc: Update Kolla Ceph document for mixed Ceph OSD deployment

Since Rocky release Kolla Ceph supports both bluestore and
filestore Ceph OSD. In multinode mode, users can overwrite
“ceph_osd_store_type” in the inventory file and deploy the mixed
Ceph OSD.

Change-Id: I4582861c81fdea5fb67114cf3ac1e48f7812f0d7
Signed-off-by: tone.zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-28 10:59:04.000000000', 'message': 'Lint fixes for playbooks and roles

This normalizes the formatting of files from playbooks and roles
folders in order to allow further hardening of linting.

Fixing linting was too big to be made in a single commit as it would
involve too many files to review and could merge conflicts with
existing changes. Thus doing it in few chunks would makes it possible.

Original full change is at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627545/ and
will be the one merging the last.

Change-Id: I73abb9ea78b8bea8d73eb95c52daacdb45f407b8

commit_message:
Lint fixes for playbooks and roles

This normalizes the formatting of files from playbooks and roles
folders in order to allow further hardening of linting.

Fixing linting was too big to be made in a single commit as it would
involve too many files to review and could merge conflicts with
existing changes. Thus doing it in few chunks would makes it possible.

Original full change is at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627545/ and
will be the one merging the last.

Change-Id: I73abb9ea78b8bea8d73eb95c52daacdb45f407b8

commit_message:
Fall back public_virtual_ip to ctlplane if External net not present

public_virtual_ip previously required the External network to be
present in networks data. Add a conditional to use the VIP on the
ctlplane if the External network is not in networks data.

Closes-Bug: #1774401
Change-Id: Ie6c3d7124d11ee89788b432da39df16f031fcf12

commit_message:
Only add internal_api_virtual_ip if InternalApi in network_data

Add's a conditional to only include internal_api_virtual_ip if
InternalApi network is defined in custom networks.

According to code comment internal_api_virtual_ip is only used
by Contrail.

Change-Id: Ifd8f59bd03c9bab1283e580a64957f201eb8f335
Closes-Bug: #1772124

Fix grafana repo

Grafana repository is moved from packagecloud to
packages.grafana.com[0]. Based on new grafana install guide[1], update
the grafana.repo

[0] https://grafana.com/blog/2019/01/05/moving-to-packages.grafana.com/
[1] http://docs.grafana.org/installation/rpm/#install-via-yum-repository

Change-Id: Ib065fdc561b72fc013b952b3df41ee83b083194e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 16:12:33.000000000', 'message': 'Force lower-case for hostname lookup

As in acd1bed60752efbe1d40a80583f0bb696b63fe07 where we started
forcing all hostnames to lower-case in order to avoid case
discrepancies. Not doing this is currently breaking standalone
deployments where the host system has capital letters in its
hostname.

Change-Id: If697a5a33b6bf56f62b038f9f0009e46a90e5ce9

commit_message:
Force lower-case for hostname lookup

As in acd1bed60752efbe1d40a80583f0bb696b63fe07 where we started
forcing all hostnames to lower-case in order to avoid case
discrepancies. Not doing this is currently breaking standalone
deployments where the host system has capital letters in its
hostname.

Change-Id: If697a5a33b6bf56f62b038f9f0009e46a90e5ce9
Closes-Bug: 1809273

messages:
[{'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-12-27 21:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-12-28 01:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26449, 'date': '2019-01-02 19:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28701, 'date': '2019-01-02 19:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is there value to making a helm test for this? Not sure if there is a more elegant way than to use kubernetes client to verify desired resources are created.'}, {'account_id': 22259, 'date': '2019-01-03 15:14:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22259, 'date': '2019-01-03 15:19:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2019-01-03 22:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2019-01-03 22:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Dustin: I struggled to come up with a valuable & elegant helm test for this too.  Since the policy is 100% dynamic based on the values overrides, you can't really make many assumptions during a helm test (e.g. "test that your serviceaccount doesn't have access to X"); and at that point, you're getting pretty far from "smoke test" into "functional test" territory.  Since there are no pods here, there are no services to ensure are running successfully smoke-wise.  I landed on trusting that helm renders PSP docs correctly, and testing appropriate PSP values during integration testing.

Very open to other opinions and ideas though!'}, {'account_id': 22259, 'date': '2019-01-04 16:00:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26449, 'date': '2019-01-09 19:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28778, 'date': '2019-01-09 20:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8749, 'date': '2019-01-09 21:29:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-01-09 21:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2019-01-10 06:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

PodSecurityPolicy objects, and ClusterRoles to provide access to them.
It will also set up one (or zero) default bindings for generic
"categories" of subjects, as desired:
- serviceaccounts

The default values specify a highly permissive security policy that is

commit_message:
Add PodSecurityPolicy chart

This adds a chart that will generate arbitrary Kubernetes
PodSecurityPolicy objects, and ClusterRoles to provide access to them.
It will also set up one (or zero) default bindings for generic
"categories" of subjects, as desired:
- serviceaccounts
- authenticated users
- unauthenticated users

The default values specify a highly permissive security policy that is
bound by default to serviceaccounts and authenticated users.  The policy
is expected to be refined over time, and should be overridden by
operators per their workloads and security needs.

Change-Id: I69917217f85881b2627706abce66c7044b40a448

commit_message:
Remove oslo.privsep exclusion

This proved to be a problem in the privileged code being executed,
not privsep itself. Once the patch in the depends-on merges it
should be safe to start allowing this version of oslo.privsep again.

Change-Id: I2dfac62932b64f015443d8144f4bb22fe98220c4
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/629335/

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-09 00:13:42.000000000', 'message': "Define types for C calls in netlink_lib

Previously this was not done, which meant all arguments were
assumed to be ints. As long as we didn't get any large pointer
addresses this worked fine, but for some reason the addition of
threading to oslo.privsep triggered larger addresses that were then
truncated. This caused segfaults in the underlying C library because
we were passing it invalid pointers.

Change-Id: I9dbbb01eac8cf7cded7794f8ba69797d6357eeec
Closes-Bug: 1810518

commit_message:
Define types for C calls in netlink_lib

Previously this was not done, which meant all arguments were
assumed to be ints. As long as we didn't get any large pointer
addresses this worked fine, but for some reason the addition of
threading to oslo.privsep triggered larger addresses that were then
truncated. This caused segfaults in the underlying C library because
we were passing it invalid pointers.

This change sets argument and return types for all of the calls
that are used in the module.

Change-Id: I9dbbb01eac8cf7cded7794f8ba69797d6357eeec
Closes-Bug: 1810518

One of the layers we consume provide this configuration option,

commit_message:
Remove `ssl_ca` configuration option provided by layer

One of the layers we consume provide this configuration option,
but it makes no sense for this subordinate charm to expose this
knob.  The configuration should be set on the principal charm.

Change-Id: I8cbe2e02a104e1cb25b99f2376fe8c91d1d80d58

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-08 19:58:33.000000000', 'message': "Remove mox usage

Introduce ''stub_out'' method to base test class

We would like to fully remove mox from the test tree.
Even for tests that don't use mox's validation, many of
them are using the symbol patching with self.stubs.Set. We can
do the same thing with the monkeypatch fixture instead.

This introduces self.stub_out to os_net_config/tests/base.py
and modifies the self.stubs.Set usage to self.stub_out.

We also remove the mox dependency.

Change-Id: Ib2fba5ecbbca5526bce2a4405704efb69ab7b5f0
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove mox usage

Introduce ''stub_out'' method to base test class

We would like to fully remove mox from the test tree.
Even for tests that don't use mox's validation, many of
them are using the symbol patching with self.stubs.Set. We can
do the same thing with the monkeypatch fixture instead.

This introduces self.stub_out to os_net_config/tests/base.py
and modifies the self.stubs.Set usage to self.stub_out.

We also remove the mox dependency.

Change-Id: Ib2fba5ecbbca5526bce2a4405704efb69ab7b5f0
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

Now, os-net-config has support for configuring sriov_numvfs. Can we move the ovs offload and other changes from puppet-tripleo to os-net-config and deprecate it from here ?'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-01-03 08:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Now, os-net-config has support for configuring sriov_numvfs. Can we move the ovs offload and other changes from puppet-tripleo to os-net-config and deprecate it from here ?

Karthik, os-net-config approach need to achieve feature parity with the current model. And also the plan to approach the upgrade from older to newer method should be published, so that deprecation could be planned accordingly.

As this is an bug fix for the existing feature, it is required to continue with this patch and in parallel implement os-net-config approach.'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-01-07 07:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-01-07 08:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-01-08 07:08:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-01-08 08:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-08 14:57:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-09 18:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-01-10 06:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Cherry Picked

commit_message:
Configure switchedv while there is no vfs bounded

When configuring vf-lag, it will not work properly when configuring switchdev
capability while there are some vfs bounded.
So removing all the binding codes as it's not needed anymore.

Closes-Bug: 1809733
Change-Id: I135cef33bece6fd31363e093e53617caac413ce0

Remove zuul-cloner from tripleo-ci job

This change removes the zuul-cloner call from the base job since
the required-projects sources are now pushed to the test instance
by the executor.

commit_message:
Remove zuul-cloner from buildimage job

This change removes the zuul-cloner call from buildimage job since
the required-projects sources are now pushed to the test instance
by the executor.

This change also refactors the buildimage jobs inheritance to have
a single list of required-projects.

This change also fixes an incorrect post-run path for the hardened
build job.

Change-Id: I189383bcfe6b1d721a16772a60c3d3491c534106

commit_message:
Add secret=true to fixed_key configuration parameter

Add secret=true to fixed_key configuration parameter as that value
shouldn't be logged.

Change-Id: I21e1246769213fb7b9e283c0ed3a369cbe780650
Closes-Bug: #1806473
(cherry picked from commit d433143ba9532ff87911b29d8e1fa14c6545c967)
(cherry picked from commit 1dbcbbc9b3684caf9e312525e44a8089f6a96b3c)

commit_message:
Enable process_stackviz function to be optional

This patch keeps the proccess_stackviz function default to true, but
allow it to be optional called, if you set PROCESS_STACKVIZ to 0.
This is required because not all the projects run tempest in the same
way.
One of the examples is the tripleo project, that has a particular way
to run tempest (in undercloud) and it's being impossible to have the
stackviz results in the logs/stackviz because the cleanup process
overwrite the stackviz data there.

Change-Id: Idf4f360ecba618900ef939d94db2ffb73e16b11a

commit_message:
Flatten Keystone service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files
into a single file that performs the docker service installation
and configuration. With this patch the baremetal version of
keystone has been removed.

Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening
Change-Id: I6140b02ad1ab6d88990e173dcf556977f065b3c5

commit_message:
Release Searchlight for the Stein-2 milestone

As planned [1], Searchlight team will do a release at Stein-2
milestone:

- searchlight: 6.0.0.0b2
- searchlight-ui: 6.0.0.0b2

The major change in this release is the use cases and vision of
Searchlight. There are several bug fixes and package upgrade
as well.

This release was mainly made possible by the contribution of:

- Thuy Dang <thuydang.de@gmail.com>
- Sa Pham <saphi070@gmail.com>

And other contributors.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/searchlight-stein-ptg

Change-Id: I3a593c093a8b9cbc3ce88d4a23cbd56574bd3fc3
Signed-off-by: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add new Sahara deliverables in Stein (plugins)

Plugins repositories have been split out from the main sahara.git
repository.
Also, make sure that sahara.git is published to pypi, because
it is required by the plugins.

Change-Id: I2cfe9a7291f8aed8e37da7b4902a62a6453ee4f6

(5 comments)

So I just broke my container updates:

	diff --git a/swift/container/server.py b/swift/container/server.py
	index c9af461f3..e3faf688f 100644
	--- a/swift/container/server.py
	+++ b/swift/container/server.py
	@@ -453,6 +453,7 @@ class ContainerController(BaseStorageServer):
		 requested_policy_index = self.get_and_validate_policy_index(req)
		 broker = self._get_container_broker(drive, part, account, container)
		 if obj:     # put container object
	+            return HTTPInternalServerError()
		     # obj put expects the policy_index header, default is for
		     # legacy support during upgrade.
		     obj_policy_index = requested_policy_index or 0


Obviously on master this fails:

ERROR: S3 error: 400 (InvalidPart): One or more of the specified parts could not be found. The part might not have been uploaded, or the specified entity tag might not have matched the part's entity tag.

But with this patch multi-part upload works fine even under failure!  Which is PRETTY FREAKING GREAT!"}]

commit_message:
s3api: Stop relying on container listings during multipart uploads

Previously, we would list the segments container before completing a
multipart upload so that we could verify ETags and sizes before
attempting to create the SLO. However, container listings are only
eventually-consistent, which meant that clients could receive a 400
response complaining that parts could not be found, even though all
parts were uploaded successfully.

Now, use the new SLO validator callback to validate segment sizes, and
use the existing SLO checks to validate ETags.

Change-Id: I57ae6756bd5f06b80cf03a6b40bf58c845f710fe
Closes-Bug: #1636663

[{'created': '2019-01-08 15:06:02.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated ansible --sudo with --become

Solves annoying warnings and prevents code from breaking on newer
ansible which dropped --sudo.

The sudo command line option has been deprecated in
favor of the "become" command line arguments. This feature will be removed in
version 2.6. Deprecation warnings can be disabled by setting
deprecation_warnings=False in ansible.cfg.

Change-Id: I0ec17d6bd6a1e3ada366c323ad67e864a7f1b5ed
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated ansible --sudo with --become

Solves annoying warnings and prevents code from breaking on newer
ansible which dropped --sudo.

The sudo command line option has been deprecated in
favor of the "become" command line arguments. This feature will be removed in
version 2.6. Deprecation warnings can be disabled by setting
deprecation_warnings=False in ansible.cfg.

Change-Id: I0ec17d6bd6a1e3ada366c323ad67e864a7f1b5ed

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers

upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I71b177a2918c9abd1ff175d68b1a6f052a428dc4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

 Utilizing the existing framework for enabling different versions of
 dvr on a node, dvr-bridge is an agent mode for the l3-agent which tries
 to remove all references to the Linux kernel utilities and instead uses Open
 vSwitch utilities (which in certain modes can result in the same actions

 l3-agent, enabling it to run on other platforms.

commit_message:
Introduce a new l3-agent mode -- dvr-bridge

 Utilizing the existing framework for enabling different versions of
 dvr on a node, dvr-bridge is an agent mode for the l3-agent which tries
 to remove all references to the Linux kernel utilities and instead uses Open
 vSwitch utilities (which in certain modes can result in the same actions
 under the hood). This change creates a layer of abstraction for the
 l3-agent, enabling it to run on other platforms.

Change-Id: Id76cc32e15cf892d0d0c45a611bf0adcd54c4aaf
Signed-off-by: Xubo Zhang <xubo.zhang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Introduce a new l3-agent mode -- dvr-bridge

 Utilizing the existing framework for enabling different versions of
 dvr on a node, dvr-bridge is an agent mode for the l3-agent which tries
 to remove all references to the Linux kernel utilities and instead uses Open
 vSwitch utilities (which in certain modes can result in the same actions
 under the hood). This change creates a layer of abstraction for the
 l3-agent, enabling it to run on other platforms.

Change-Id: I59d596fc6db741c144605cb7eef61921ef00054b

[{'created': '2018-03-19 07:58:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add check_process() for mysqldump

commit_message:
Add check_process() for mysqldump

Before, mysqldump had redirect parts for stderr but did not have
any check logic for that. So redirect part was deleted to avoid
reporting which is always success.

But, mysqldump does not emit not only errors but also warnings like
"Warning: ..." or "[Warning] ...". This warnings should not be
considered to error, so add check_process for filtering that like
other backup strategies.

Also, change message log level to debug for the right purpose and
change print location not to print None when the output file is empty.

Change-Id: I27b1b0628e79ca1c7b0c1ab5f939b5960ec3177a
Close-Bug: 1756806

commit_message:
Remove unused services in tripleo deploy

When rendering templates, check for services mapped to OS::Heat::None
and rewrite roles data to remove them. It reduces the numbers of
resources created, and improve in particular container image building.

Change-Id: I37aa673937681d5142feb74e89ca85fdb471db57
(cherry picked from commit bf6f2b408362ac4d840a1231f048e32d02b90fae)

commit_message:
Add version to python execution

We invoke python to parse the templates in the tripleo deployment
command so we need to make sure that runs as either python2 or python3
since the python command may not be available.

Change-Id: I242fdd717d9e52de0b122d50cf7d6a9ad7f0e041
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
(cherry picked from commit eb31beb7f759601cbd28b74534518d9e75aedc3f)

commit_message:
Fix defaults to templates, roles-file and plan-environment

This change updates the --templates parameter to now have a default
which makes it optional and only necessary when something different than
the default.  Additionally we're removing the defaults as it causes
issues, when someone download the overcloud plan on the undercloud
because it would use the current working director to load the file.
Now it will use the --templates folder as a base for the default value
and will take the specific file if --roles-file or
--plan-environment-file is specified.

Change-Id: Ia0c8a7caaf8f24ef1e5b0858d57827633f2473e9
Closes-Bug: #1797922
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 45395e8c0d8b2f790965f3b450b8cfdb95848d9e)

-1 is on /allocations/count for the reasons mentioned within, if for some reason that mode comes back around.

As I recall the consumer type concept was to address counting of instances?

Would it make any sense to be able to list all the allocations for a project/use pair and then pass the associated uuids into some (fake)SQL like:

  select count(*) from instances where uuid in(that big list of uuids)

Or more generically has there ever been discussion of a generic uuid lookup service: give a uuid get back its canonical URI https://cloud.com/compute/servers/{uuid}
