commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I11f742b525d8d7328a9d46f0bd46da112e27ad82

commit_message:
Skip v2 block-storage tests when service is not found

We have skips in for the cloud functional tests. Add the same skips for the
resource layer tests.

Since the resource layer is tied to version 2, put in an explicit
config override in the setUp to set block_storage_api_version.

Shift block_storage v2 tests to use self.user_cloud and not self.conn.

In doing so, test_type turns out to need admin privs, so use self.op_cloud
for it.

Change-Id: I8b231e7b5e0ebad6751702d9f0cb85e3d2192ac5

We need an in-place update of /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts for the changes to be
visible to running containers. This works around the issue until we have a
better long-term solution - make a copy, update using lineinfile, then

commit_message:
Workaround ssh_known_hosts changes not being propagated to containers

We need an in-place update of /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts for the changes to be
visible to running containers. This works around the issue until we have a
better long-term solution - make a copy, update using lineinfile, then
clobber the original file.

Closes-bug: #1810932
Change-Id: Ie6af5908d4b79bad094bce31e8e853678c0e843c
(cherry picked from commit ca60b82be840a91e76a965438f0cdd35c9a2baca)

@Sean, thanks for adding me to this review. I will take a look ASAP.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-12-19 12:58:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I only had a brief chance to look at this, but can state this is definitely not the correct way to resolve the issue. Bear in mind the locks were added to prevent multiple (duplicate) entries in the cache, so adding "update_cache=True" will simply defeat the entire purpose of the original change. That would essentially swap one problem for another.

I'll spend more time on this, and I'm sure that we can work together to find a resolution that solves this problem while retaining fixes for previous problems.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-12-29 20:32:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I added a note and offer an alternative approach in https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1801595/comments/8.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-01-03 21:35:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Shay, do you still plan to pursue this patch? If so, you're still welcome to use the contents of the patch that I attached to the Launchpad bug.

Please let me know if you're not going to work on this so that I can pick up the work."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-01-09 16:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This has been not been touched in a long time.  abishop will submit a new patch.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 07:12:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix create volume from cache behaviour.

- till Pike if a driver raised an exception during create_cloned_volume,
  flow manager would create a new image cache entry from a full copy.
  in Pike an effort to reduce lock scopes added a default not to update
  cache, breaking this behaviour which XtremIO rely on.
  this change revert the behaviour as it was before Pike.

  Closes-Bug: #1801595

Change-Id: If14659f8f06cbcd38069a11376e77e5f7ec95e6e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix create volume from cache behaviour.

- till Pike if a driver raised an exception during create_cloned_volume,
  flow manager would create a new image cache entry from a full copy.
  in Pike an effort to reduce lock scopes added a default not to update
  cache, breaking this behaviour which XtremIO rely on.
  this change revert the behaviour as it was before Pike.

  Closes-Bug: #1801595

Change-Id: If14659f8f06cbcd38069a11376e77e5f7ec95e6e

(2 comments)

Some inline comments.

Fwiw I'm a fan of the idea of validations. I'm not sure we need a separate step for them anymore now that we have deploy_steps_tasks it seems they could be implemented inline with little to no orchestration cost to them. Like I mention inline Ansible tagging conventions could help us to make them confurable (a way to enable or disable them via Ansible tags).

See also an old attempt I made at this idea here: Ib6f1153f8c2b857c1b2b5c9172a9836da70fe0ce"}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-12-11 15:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

[{'created': '2018-12-18 10:18:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lint

Fixes lint issues now that lint jobs fail properly.

Verify that this can be set to true and is not indeed
requiring a string. If so, add a lint ignore comment.

subject: ceph improvements: failure domains, root hierarchy ..etc
messages:
[{'account_id': 29106, 'date': '2018-11-26 15:42:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29106, 'date': '2018-11-26 15:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29106, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29106, 'date': '2018-11-26 22:36:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-27 01:27:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Using multiple root hierachies is considerd a deprecated approach to configuring SSD/HDD OSDs within Ceph. Nowdays the standard with Luminous + versions is to use CRUSH device classes. I'm also not entirely sure we need provisioner to support this, as it's done on the pool level within Ceph.

Please review my PS here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619817/ . As I will be pushing to merge this code upstream.

Thanks for the great work though, as my PS was largely inspired by your work. ;)"}, {'account_id': 29106, 'date': '2018-11-27 01:52:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Using multiple root hierachies is considerd a deprecated approach
 > to configuring SSD/HDD OSDs within Ceph. Nowdays the standard with
 > Luminous + versions is to use CRUSH device classes. I'm also not
 > entirely sure we need provisioner to support this, as it's done on
 > the pool level within Ceph.
 > 
 > Please review my PS here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619817/
 > . As I will be pushing to merge this code upstream.
 > 
 > Thanks for the great work though, as my PS was largely inspired by
 > your work. ;)

 > Using multiple root hierachies is considerd a deprecated approach
 > to configuring SSD/HDD OSDs within Ceph. Nowdays the standard with
 > Luminous + versions is to use CRUSH device classes. I'm also not
 > entirely sure we need provisioner to support this, as it's done on
 > the pool level within Ceph.
 > 
 > Please review my PS here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619817/
 > . As I will be pushing to merge this code upstream.
 > 
 > Thanks for the great work though, as my PS was largely inspired by
 > your work. ;)

Hi Matthew,

How can we request the disk from the SSD/HDD pool to k8s without a storage class? 

 > Using multiple root hierachies is considerd a deprecated approach
 > to configuring SSD/HDD OSDs within Ceph. Nowdays the standard with
 > Luminous + versions is to use CRUSH device classes. I'm also not
 > entirely sure we need provisioner to support this, as it's done on
 > the pool level within Ceph.
 > 
 > Please review my PS here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619817/
 > . As I will be pushing to merge this code upstream.
 > 
 > Thanks for the great work though, as my PS was largely inspired by
 > your work. ;)

Hi Matthew, How can we request disk from ceph pool in k8s without using storage classes? Also device classes are useful to distinguish storage types (SAS/SSD/SATA/PATA). We create crush maps, create pool to use that crush map. Creating the new root hierarchy is up to the user. The changes I have provided should allow users to configure the root, crush_maps, storage classes when they use HDD, SSD's together. We have been using these changes in our lab. Also a change to modify device classes for nodes. You may be correct on your comments. however I am done with rebasing again. I have already did a rebase once."}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-11-27 05:23:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Could you fix the whitespaces? No need to rebase just yet. I'll bring this PS up for review with the team."}, {'account_id': 29106, 'date': '2018-11-27 14:50:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 29106, 'date': '2018-11-27 14:51:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Could you fix the whitespaces? No need to rebase just yet. I'll
 > bring this PS up for review with the team.

Done."}, {'account_id': 29106, 'date': '2019-01-09 16:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Another fix already went in'}]

commit_message:
ceph improvements: failure domains, root hierarchy ..etc

Added supported for SSD, HDD co-existtance
Support for failure domains based on setup
Support for root hierarchy based on input for OSDs
Support for differeent pools for SSD/HDD/any device class
Support for multiple storage classes (SSD/HDD)
general as default storage class
rbd provisioners for HDD along with client key generator and cleaner

Story: #27999
Change-Id: I06e67df53b8db0ea7af2b8fe0a3d90634e3b3ef0
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>
Signed-off-by: kranthikirang <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-01-09 15:56:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-01-09 15:58:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-09 15:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-09 15:56:21.000000000', 'message': 'Pull fetch-output back out of base

Instead of updating upload-logs to upload docs and artifacts, or
making upload-docs and upload-artifacts roles, if we rework fetch-output
to put things into the logs directory appropriately when it fetches,
we can accomplish the same outcome more simply.

Since we just landed fetch-output and nothing depends on it yet, removing
it from base jobs will let us safely make the changes and validate
via base-test without too many dances.

Change-Id: I2c411358e4857f74a44e5ea083a57f58e30c1ae7
'}]
commit_message:
Pull fetch-output back out of base

Instead of updating upload-logs to upload docs and artifacts, or
making upload-docs and upload-artifacts roles, if we rework fetch-output
to put things into the logs directory appropriately when it fetches,
we can accomplish the same outcome more simply.

Since we just landed fetch-output and nothing depends on it yet, removing
it from base jobs will let us safely make the changes and validate
via base-test without too many dances.

Change-Id: I2c411358e4857f74a44e5ea083a57f58e30c1ae7

commit_message:
Add warning to highlight frequent TLS issue

This relates to the  most common deployment error we come across
when deploying TripleO with TLS Everywhere. Commonly, a deployer
attempting to use an existing or new IdM (FreeIPA) is unreachble
to the undercloud, overcloud nodes, or both. This warning serves
to re-iterate the importance of this connectiviy.

Change-Id: I6084a4032bdb6b9e8655972e388dda48c60b76c3

commit_message:
Fixing a broken links on how to upgrading to a next major release.

The page https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-docs/latest/install/post_deployment/upgrade.html
doesn't exist and the server return a 404 error.

Using ref and doc markers to avoid error with these links and documents moving
in the future

Change-Id: I7004a8002517881761f583696ef31582e4fcd3e7
Closes-Bug: 1808987

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-07 13:42:31.000000000', 'message': 'Adjust ssh timeouts

Generic driver jobs are failing because of timeouts when
establishing the initial ssh connection from manila-share
to the service VM.

Bump up the default value of the connection timeout for paramiko
client and also set the banner timeout since the failure occurred
during banner exchange.  Set the two timeouts to the same value
for now.  This ensures that the connection timeout is at least as
long as the banner timeout and there is no current need in manila
to control these independently.

This is more of a workaround than a real fix since a real fix
would remove the delay during banner exchange.  I suspect that
the real fix will need to be in neutron/ovs though.

Change-Id: Ib5e59faaf9667b9cb5e7d4072531b7d6c3d4da39
Partial-bug: #1807216
(cherry picked from commit 7548706b0928f2c23bf27e10d116ceca585660e4)
(cherry picked from commit 8919db0186f8da9f2f492d80c8a3700c3d9367d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust ssh timeouts

Generic driver jobs are failing because of timeouts when
establishing the initial ssh connection from manila-share
to the service VM.

Bump up the default value of the connection timeout for paramiko
client and also set the banner timeout since the failure occurred
during banner exchange.  Set the two timeouts to the same value
for now.  This ensures that the connection timeout is at least as
long as the banner timeout and there is no current need in manila
to control these independently.

This is more of a workaround than a real fix since a real fix
would remove the delay during banner exchange.  I suspect that
the real fix will need to be in neutron/ovs though.

Change-Id: Ib5e59faaf9667b9cb5e7d4072531b7d6c3d4da39
Partial-bug: #1807216
(cherry picked from commit 7548706b0928f2c23bf27e10d116ceca585660e4)

commit_message:
Limit duration of setup HEAT outputs via update prepare task

* Avoid potential deallock by limiting maximum duration of setup HEAT.
* Improves the error handling and avoids use of ignore_errors.
* Allows us to disable timeouts by defining timeout_multiplier=0
* Allows tunning via timeout_multiplier variable which defaults to 1.0
* Avoids need to define lots of timeout variables for each task
that may get stalled.
* Use a default timeout of 1200 seconds which was configured as 2x
the average duration of historical values for this task, shortly if
this stept step takes more than this the job will probably never finish.

Change-Id: Idadf0fc63658fb01d97582e4956832416b1b80a8
Related-Bug: #1786764

move base into openstack-zuul-jobs.

commit_message:
Updated laravel legacy jobs

moved bindep role from roles list to include_role element
inside tasks definition list to ensure the execution order:
* first add the php7 ppa
* then run the bindep role

Change-Id: Ibbdd9350e991cedfe5bfde8097c7dab5ee9c605d

@Erno: you'll probably want to write a release note for this and then we should release a new Rocky.  (I'm thinking a note because this update won't affect operators who aren't using the conversion plugin as part of the import workflow.)

commit_message:
Image conversion fails

It is not possible to convert glance images as it fails with error,
NoSuchOptError: no such option 'conversion_plugin_options' in group
[DEFAULT] as there is no 'conversion_plugin_options' option or group
in glance-image-import.conf file.

Used correct option group 'image_conversion' to fetch the image
'output_format' option.

Change-Id: Ia7ced170bcddcd3639b7edfb644deef3018b11a8
Closes-Bug: #1805765
(cherry picked from commit 8ee37b7d7ca7d5d2d5e8ef2adc61306f3b57a0a2)

commit_message:
Use only a single worker process

Reduce the control plane's memory footprint by limiting the number of
OpenStack worker processes to one per-service.

Change-Id: I202dc2111c6cadf4b6045ed09705d04f9336d0de
Story: 2004704
Task: 28733
(cherry picked from commit 5bcad3c90e4b7b7c11d09709fcaaf959b308a039)

messages:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-12-20 13:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For me to make the version comparison work I need something like:

    - name: test
      hosts: localhost
      tasks:
        - debug:
            var: ansible_version
        - name: Find persistent SSH connection control sockets
          local_action:
            module: find
            file_type: any
            path: "~/.ansible/cp/"
            patterns: '[a-f0-9]{10}'
            use_regex: True
          register: cp_sockets
          when: ansible_version.full | version_compare('2.3', 'ge')

ansible_version looks like:

    TASK [debug] *******************************************************************
    ok: [localhost] => {
        "ansible_version": {
            "full": "2.2.3.0", 
            "major": 2, 
            "minor": 2, 
            "revision": 3, 
            "string": "2.2.3.0"
        }
    }'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-20 16:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> For me to make the version comparison work I need something like:
 > 
 > - name: test
 > hosts: localhost
 > tasks:
 > - debug:
 > var: ansible_version
 > - name: Find persistent SSH connection control sockets
 > local_action:
 > module: find
 > file_type: any
 > path: "~/.ansible/cp/"
 > patterns: '[a-f0-9]{10}'
 > use_regex: True
 > register: cp_sockets
 > when: ansible_version.full | version_compare('2.3', 'ge')
 > 
 > ansible_version looks like:
 > 
 > TASK [debug] *******************************************************************
 > ok: [localhost] => {
 > "ansible_version": {
 > "full": "2.2.3.0",
 > "major": 2,
 > "minor": 2,
 > "revision": 3,
 > "string": "2.2.3.0"
 > }
 > }

Thanks. I've submitted a patch to stable/{queens,pike,ocata} to fix this. We don't have any references to ansible_version in master.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-01-07 09:38:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Should we abandon this now that you've fixed the `when` logic?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-09 15:20:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Should we abandon this now that you've fixed the `when` logic?

I entered my 'Ansible version playground' and you are quite right - this works with the version logic fix."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-09 15:20:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not required - fix when logic instead.'}]

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be

eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
implement identity v3 Proxy "unassign_project_role_from_user"

identity/v3/_proxy.py lacks the reverse method of
 "assign_project_role_to_user" although this method is implemented
in Project class.
With this patchset call to
 conn.identity.unassign_project_role_from_user(project,user,role)
works

Fix no known issue; just adds functionnality

Change-Id: I066fcb378cb3b3449bbe12b6186caaf63432c2af

subject: WIP - Single pacemaker node updates
messages:
[{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-07 21:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-08 21:42:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Actually I don't think we need this. need to test further."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-09 15:12:22.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Not needed as you'll just end up with some outage during an update of a single node pacemaker controller.  This is expected as there is no HA with a single node."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-07 21:53:52.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - Single pacemaker node updates

Previously, we would shutdown the entire cluster during updates between
step 1 and step 4. The puppet code in step 3 that will query the
database/rabbitmq will fail because these services are off. This change
uses pacemaker to determine the cluster size and performs a shortened
update for a single node instance. Since single node pacemaker cannot
ensure any actual HA, there may be service disruptions during updates.

Change-Id: I4e06574fcacd20f07335824212bec1b33f8c434d
'}]
commit_message:
WIP - Single pacemaker node updates

Previously, we would shutdown the entire cluster during updates between
step 1 and step 4. The puppet code in step 3 that will query the
database/rabbitmq will fail because these services are off. This change
uses pacemaker to determine the cluster size and performs a shortened
update for a single node instance. Since single node pacemaker cannot
ensure any actual HA, there may be service disruptions during updates.

Change-Id: I4e06574fcacd20f07335824212bec1b33f8c434d

commit_message:
Let the operator manage openshift updates and upgrades

This remove the upgrade code to ensure that TripleO will not get
involved in the business of updating and upgrading OpenShift clusters
as it currently involved manual steps for clusters using glusterfs.

Instead, the operator is invited to upgrade OpenShift separately from
TripleO and follow the OpenShift upgrade documentation.

[1] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/upgrading/automated_upgrades.html#special-considerations-for-glusterfs
[2] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/upgrading/automated_upgrades.html

Change-Id: I6033525cde40fd44d648cef792efbca6901e88f0
Closes-Bug: #1810812

commit_message:
Silence syncronize on post to avoid console spam

Adds --quiet to rsync in order to avoid spanning the console with
hundreads of files copied.

Improves UX by making easier to read the log and to find the real
error message.

Change-Id: I99cc6f98ad61ac0ca5398a7d121963f85335f1e7
Relates-To: I364e4cc7607e94e82420e108ac03520dd4e62eab

commit_message:
Add System<->Manager linkage

Redfish data model rests on three interlinked
entities - ComputerSystem(s), Manager(s) and Chassis. As of this
moment, sushy does not support traversing between these entities
at the Sushy abstraction level, despite the availability of such
linkage in the JSON documents sushy feeds on.

This change establishes System->Managers and Managers->System
links.

Change-Id: I54b0fdeebdea1e13c2b6912ee4c97776ebccaf03
Story: 2004512
Task: 28240

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-09 02:55:23.000000000', 'message': "docker-puppet.py: only create docker-puppet.sh when it doesn't exist

In docker-puppet.py, we only create docker-puppet.sh script if it
doesn't exist yet. It's not useful to re-create it and it can be
dangerous to regenerate the script while docker-puppet.py is running,
since we bind mount the script to the containers.
It's possible that during a multi-process task, the script changes and
then the entrypoint fails to run correctly if the interpreter is not
present in the script.

This patch makes sure that we create the script only when needed, and
also that we remove it before running docker-puppet.py, which will be
useful when doing clean deployments or upgrades.

Context: https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1844
Change-Id: I0ac69adb47f59a9ca82764b5537532014a782913
"}]
commit_message:
docker-puppet.py: only create docker-puppet.sh when it doesn't exist

In docker-puppet.py, we only create docker-puppet.sh script if it
doesn't exist yet. It's not useful to re-create it and it can be
dangerous to regenerate the script while docker-puppet.py is running,
since we bind mount the script to the containers.
It's possible that during a multi-process task, the script changes and
then the entrypoint fails to run correctly if the interpreter is not
present in the script.

This patch makes sure that we create the script only when needed, and
also that we remove it before running docker-puppet.py, which will be
useful when doing clean deployments or upgrades.

Context: https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1844
Change-Id: I0ac69adb47f59a9ca82764b5537532014a782913

[{'created': '2018-10-31 13:09:52.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor create_server to smartly handle advanced images

Create new base class called BaseScenarioTest for provisioning
resources in a way more similar to API base classs and allowing
to allocate server at class scope (IE inside resource_setup method).

This new class could be the barebone for new methods rewritten
from scrach without keeping backward compatibility with
the old BaseTempestTestCase test case (for example for helping
creating resources to login to created server).

Now create_server method returns only server details instead of
Nova API client answer body.

Add create_ssh_client method to handle SSH connection distruction
at the end of the test.

Make sure either server and SSH connection are created using
advance image settings if required by just passing a simple
method parameter (advanced_image=True) or setting the
at test class level.

commit_message:
Refactor create_server to smartly handle advanced images

Create new base class called BaseScenarioTest for provisioning
resources in a way more similar to API base classs and allowing
to allocate server at class scope (IE inside resource_setup method).

This new class could be the barebone for implementing new methods
rewritten from scrach without keeping backward compatibility with
the old BaseTempestTestCase test case (for example for helping
creating resources to login to created server).

Now create_server method returns only server details instead of
Nova API client answer body.

Add create_ssh_client method to handle SSH connection distruction
at the end of the test.

Make sure either server and SSH connection are created using
advance image settings if required by just passing a simple
method parameter (advanced_image=True) or setting the
at test class level.

Please see my comments in PS23'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-08-28 10:21:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-08-28 10:23:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-08-29 08:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

(3 comments)

I made some change on ip_version when creating subnet and when creating floating IP. The idea is loginable base class is focused in making life simpler when having to do with floating IP and SSH. The IP version to be used by default has to be therefore the same required by tempest.conf for SSH connection. I am therefore making sure created ports have a fixed IP of the same IP version than required one, and that floating IP redirect to such fixed IP address. I am also making sure the router is bound to a subnet created with required IP version. I never tried this with IPv6 as it requires an installation that uses IPv6 as external network. I should at least test it with an IPv6 test case connected to an IPv4 external network. Therefore are therefore work in progress to test this change.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-08-29 08:12:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-08-29 08:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-08-29 09:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 17:37:06.000000000', 'message': 'Create helper tools for logging to VMs

This change has been introduced as part of
creating new tests that has to SSH to VMs

Because configuring network, ports, secgroups and
servers that allows SSH connection it is a
tedious repetitive and error-prone work, some
new "highlevel" methods are being introduced.

Existing "setup_network_and_server" is not flexible
enougth for most of tests and therefore useless.

Minimal ammount of code to execute a command on a VM:

  class MyTest(BaseLoginableTestCase):

  def test_exec_command():
    network = self.create_loginable_network()
    port = self.create_loginable_port(network)
    server = self.create_loginable_server(port)
    ssh = self.ssh_to_port(port)
    ssh.exec_command("hostname")

Below required resources used to login to a VM are created
during 'cls.resource_setup()' call:

  cls.loginable_keypair   # SSH keypair
  cls.loginable_router    # Router to external network
  cls.loginable_secgroup  # It allows SSH and ping

Conflicts:
	neutron_tempest_plugin/common/ssh.py

Change-Id: I154a5629dd29263ed253eff26bbd0e571e901aa7

commit_message:
[WIP] Create helper tools for logging to VMs

This change has been introduced as part of
creating new tests that has to SSH to VMs

Because configuring network, ports, secgroups and
servers that allows SSH connection it is a
tedious repetitive and error-prone work, some
new "highlevel" methods are being introduced.

Existing "setup_network_and_server" is not flexible
enougth for most of tests and therefore useless.

Minimal ammount of code to execute a command on a VM:

  class MyTest(BaseLoginableTestCase):

      def test_ssh_client_to_port(self):
            network = self.create_loginable_network()
            port = self.create_loginable_port(network)
            server = self.create_loginable_server(port)
            ssh = self.ssh_client_to_port(port)
            output = ssh.exec_command("echo hello")
            self.assertEqual("hello\n", output)

Below required resources used to login to a VM are created
during 'cls.resource_setup()' call:

  cls.loginable_keypair   # SSH keypair
  cls.loginable_router    # Router to external network
  cls.loginable_secgroup  # It allows SSH and ping

Change-Id: I154a5629dd29263ed253eff26bbd0e571e901aa7

commit_message:
Write DevStack test cases for devstack/customize_image.sh

Provide some DevStack test cases useful for testing
guest image customization implemented in DevStack
plugin. These tests helped a lot to debug and test
devstack plugin without having to run the whole
stack.sh script.

Please note there is no CI job executing this scripts.
Therefore developer is expected to execute them by hand
before submitting changes to devstack plugin.

Change-Id: I83ae0e81474abfc7df7cb30c6a5895625c1dda73

commit_message:
Fix parameters when raising L2GatewayConnectionNotFound

L2GatewayConnectionNotFound expects id and not gateway_id

Change-Id: I4c0d5560d49b4cb8675c495eb58c9e683a9c6e3f

commit_message:
Remove dead code from policy module

These variables and functions were not used anywhere, and checks for new rules
(policy refreshing) is actually done in oslo.policy nowadays. So this removed
unused code.

Change-Id: Iaac8c95ced31872fc213ff871b546cf5f27b2e74

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-04 10:41:29.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for installing correct version of ruby bundler

See https://github.com/bundler/bundler/issues/6870

Bundler 2.x dropped support for Ruby < 2.3 so now we detect ruby
version and install last known to work version.

This means that newer OS will get newer versions of bundler.

Change-Id: I906ad01187ad5b929b378107de065d32d23c5fc2
Closes-Bug: #1810401
'}, {'created': '2019-01-04 11:01:33.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for installing correct version of ruby bundler

commit_message:
Workaround for installing correct version of ruby bundler

See https://github.com/bundler/bundler/issues/6870

Bundler 2.x dropped support for Ruby < 2.3 so now we detect ruby
version and install last known to work version.

This means that newer OS will get newer versions of bundler.

Change-Id: I906ad01187ad5b929b378107de065d32d23c5fc2
Closes-Bug: #1810401

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-12-18 04:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-12-18 08:58:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Generally speaking, we may need to avoid calling __getattribute__ inside __getattr__, because if __getattribute__ failed then __getattr__ will be called automatically. So there will be a recursive call.

Seems fortunately python3 interpreter will stop this recursive call when recursive depth achieved 2 (What I see is 2). But I think we'd better to catch the exception explicitly, like:

171         if name == 'tags':
172             try:
173                 return self.__getattribute__('tags')
174             except AttributeError:
175                 return None
176         return getattr(self.tags, name)"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 10:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Generally speaking, we may need to avoid calling __getattribute__
 > inside __getattr__, because if __getattribute__ failed then
 > __getattr__ will be called automatically. So there will be a
 > recursive call.
 > 
 > Seems fortunately python3 interpreter will stop this recursive call
 > when recursive depth achieved 2 (What I see is 2). But I think we'd
 > better to catch the exception explicitly, like:
 > 
 > 171         if name == 'tags':
 > 172             try:
 > 173                 return self.__getattribute__('tags')
 > 174             except AttributeError:
 > 175                 return None
 > 176         return getattr(self.tags, name)

Did you try this, because I was unable to generate the recursion that you are describing. What "failure" of __getattribute__ can happen?

As things stand, if the 'tags' attribute is not present self.__getattribute__('tags') will raise AttributeError, which is pretty much exactly what we want (we don't want None, because that presumes the attribute is there with a value). What are the other ways that it can fail?'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-12-18 10:41:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Yes, I tried. You just need to set breakpoint in line "return self.__getattribute__('tags')", then you can see it enter twice.

If raise AttributeError here (the default/current behaviour), __getattr__ will re-entry, just as I said in above.

Your code seems can work, because python interpreter seems captured the re-entry. But if there's no side-effect found, I prefer to catch the exception explicitly as I mentioned.

What I tested is py35 and functional-py35'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 10:56:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> If raise AttributeError here (the default/current behaviour),
 > __getattr__ will re-entry, just as I said in above.

Can you write up a minimal test case for this, because I'm not seeing the behavior you are describing when I try myself, and I think I must be missing a detail from your description, and thus doing it wrong, and seeing an example will probably get us to a result sooner.

It could be that this is only an apparent in 3.5, I've been testing with 3.7 and 2.7.

In any case :

The desire outcome is that when the tags attribute is requested two things happen:

* if 'tags' is present, return the value
* if 'tags' is not present, raise AttributeError


To avoid possible interference from super classes, it may make sense to change the call to __getattribute__ to  object.__getattribute__(self, name)

But in any case it would be great to see the failure you mode you describe. It's not that I don't believe you, it's simply that I can't make it happen, and would like to."}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-12-18 12:58:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Chris

This is command:
python3 -m testtools.run glance.tests.unit.test_quota.TestQuotaImageTagsProxy.test_tags_deepcopy

This is code:
  167     def __getattr__(self, name):
  168         # Use __getattribute__ for 'tags' in case tags itself
  169         # is request, which may happen during a deepcopy() and
  170         # similar operations.
  171         if name == 'tags':
  172             # try:
CC173             import pdb; pdb.set_trace()
  174             return self.__getattribute__('tags')
  175             # except AttributeError:
  176             #     return None
  177         return getattr(self.tags, name)
  178

This is some output:
  /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/testtools/testcase.py(719)_run_test_method()
-> return self._get_test_method()()
  /opt/stack/glance/glance/tests/unit/test_quota.py(606)test_tags_deepcopy()
-> proxy_copy = copy.deepcopy(proxy)
  /usr/lib/python3.5/copy.py(182)deepcopy()

--Return--

(Pdb) n
AttributeError: 'QuotaImageTagsProxy' object has no attribute 'tags'
> /opt/stack/glance/glance/quota/__init__.py(177)__getattr__()

(Pdb) p name
'__setstate__'
(Pdb)


You can see line 174 entry twice, and before the second time there's an exception AttributeError which is caused by __getattribute__

my env is ubuntu16.04, and /usr/bin/python3 -> python3.5"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:30:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Okay digging around in this has presented a problem not exactly like Liang Fang has pointed out, but related.

Essentially the implementation of __getattr__ is entirely wrong, and it's only during deepcopy that it gets tickled. I have a new version in progress."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 17:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The main "wrongness" here is that this is bad python:

    >>> getattr(set(['a', 'b']), 'b')
    Traceback (most recent call last):   
    File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
    AttributeError: 'set' object has no attribute 'b'

But that's exactly what this code is claiming to do. The reason we don't see it as a problem is because the tags are generally accessed via the __iter__ and __contains___ methods'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 17:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 17:59:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Oh crikey, I see. After removing the __getattr__ method and seeing what failed, I think I get it now: we're after the attributes on the set object.

That's a hell of a thing to do...

Anyway, that explains why the failing tests are as they are. I guess the right thing to do here is the minimal change. I'm still not certain that returning None is the right thing, but since the methods that are called on the set (add and remove) also return None, I guess we'll go with that.

I don't recommend keeping this implementation."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 18:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-12-18 20:44:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I still have the question I brought up in IRC, namely, do we need to implement __deepcopy__ on this thing if it's going to be deep copied?  My understanding of these proxy classes is that they're supposed to be transparent--that's why all the dunder methods are implemented with respect to the 'tags' member, because for all intents and purposes, this is supposed to "look" like a set to other code interacting with it.  I think the problem is that when you call deepcopy() on it, the copy module recognizes this proxy class as what it really is (not as what it's a proxy for), and it tries to make a deep copy of a quota proxy object, not a deep copy of a set, and madcap hijinks ensue.

We have these proxy objects all over the place (don't blame me, I didn't do it!), so I think it's important to try to get this as "right" as we can (or, at least get it clear enough so we all understand what's happening).'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 21:13:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Brian, I think if I expand the tests a bit to make sure that the deepcopies object still has working add and remove methods we'll see if we need __deepcopy__ or not."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 21:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-12-20 01:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Thanks for working on this guys! Happy to see the code reinforced.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-09 13:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Just want to add my belated thanks to Chris for sticking with this!'}]

commit_message:
Make QuotaImageTagsProxy deep-copyable

Infinite recursion is possible if you try to deepcopy a
QuotaImageTagsProxy object, which is something that happens when using
oslo.policy 1.43.1 and beyond.

By adding a __gettattribute__ within the __getattr__ method we can break
the loop when the name of the attribute is 'tags'.

The added test will fail (with infinite recursion) if the new code is
removed.

For completeness a test is added checking what happens when the tags
attribute is removed.

The thing that is not immediately clear from the __getattr__ code is
that it is not for getting at the tags themselves, it is for getting
at the methods on the set object at self.tags. The non-obviousness
of this led to rather a lot of confusion while trying to get this
code right. It isn't really "right" now, but rather: safe in the
context of its use.

Change-Id: Ic47c9bf8e9b97de5a5a49a35f631753c54e0e2af
Related-Bug: #1808063

commit_message:
use payloads for SEGMENT AFTER_DELETE events

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for SEGMENT AFTER_DELETE events.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html

Change-Id: Icf5f82c16b4ccbad9baf12750e23375d9910182a

Hi, I was trying to run all tests as pointed previously, but encountered some fails. After closer investigation I found that some tests from "all" set are trying to test functionality that has been marked as "optional" and SPDK driver does not support it (like tempest.api.volume.admin.test_snapshot_manage.SnapshotManageAdminTest.test_unmanage_manage_snapshot). I've also found that some tests assume scsi interface which is not true for SPDK driver as it uses only NVMe-oF.
Example: tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_extend.VolumesExtendAttachedTest.test_extend_attached_volume
Output:
Command: tee -a /sys/bus/scsi/drivers/sd/None:None:None:None/rescan
Exit code: 1

My suggestion is to leave tests set as it is for Stein release and work on correct tests sets after release. Please let me know what is your opinion on that.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-12-21 14:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

Adding SPDK NVMe-oF target driver

Adding Storage Performance Development Kit target
driver. This driver uses SPDK NVMe-oF target and
provides new type of target driver.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-04 10:49:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add kill_timeout to AsyncProcess

AsyncProcess.stop() method has now additional parameter
kill_timeout. If this is set to some value different than
None, eventlet.green.subprocess.Popen.wait() will be called
with this timeout, so TimeoutExpired exception will be raised
in case if process will not be killed for this "kill_timeout"
time.
In such case process will be killed "again" with SIGKILL signal
to make sure that it is gone.

This should fix problem with failing fullstack tests, when
ovs_agent process is sometimes not killed and test timeout was
reached in this wait() method.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/async_process.py

Change-Id: I1e12255e5e142c395adf4e67be9d9da0f7a3d4fd
Closes-Bug: #1798472
(cherry picked from commit 9b23abbdb68f7e0c80c305ec1874281f6dea7e9e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add kill_timeout to AsyncProcess

AsyncProcess.stop() method has now additional parameter
kill_timeout. If this is set to some value different than
None, eventlet.green.subprocess.Popen.wait() will be called
with this timeout, so TimeoutExpired exception will be raised
in case if process will not be killed for this "kill_timeout"
time.
In such case process will be killed "again" with SIGKILL signal
to make sure that it is gone.

This should fix problem with failing fullstack tests, when
ovs_agent process is sometimes not killed and test timeout was
reached in this wait() method.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/async_process.py

Change-Id: I1e12255e5e142c395adf4e67be9d9da0f7a3d4fd
Closes-Bug: #1798472
(cherry picked from commit 9b23abbdb68f7e0c80c305ec1874281f6dea7e9e)

[{'created': '2019-01-09 10:45:13.000000000', 'message': 'Import swift-bench release history

swift-bench was not released since we introduced the releases
repository. In order to stop having it flagged as missing (and
to have it mentioned on releases.o.o), import past release
history in the repository. Future releases (if any) will use
the releases repository.

Change-Id: Idd0b3cfc86d81faa82f381a714566b14894c9384
'}]
commit_message:
Import swift-bench release history

swift-bench was not released since we introduced the releases
repository. In order to stop having it flagged as missing (and
to have it mentioned on releases.o.o), import past release
history in the repository. Future releases (if any) will use
the releases repository.

Change-Id: Idd0b3cfc86d81faa82f381a714566b14894c9384

commit_message:
Add release notes for new vendorized static files

Commit I33eda3d4cbb0911143deedafb1bce4ee7101e06f refactored static files
but didn't include release notes. This patch adds it.

commit_message:
Update CRD when NP has namespaceSelectors

When a namespace is created, deleted or updated and
its labels matches the namespaceSelector of a NP,
the CRD and the respective sg must be updated.

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies

Change-Id: I515de28647f5f06248555733c27dd4f5a56149ec

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 05:31:07.000000000', 'message': 'cinder-volume: Stop masking IOError different than ENOSPC

When glanceclient raises an IOError with a different errno than ENOSPC,
cinder-volume silently masked it and continued its volume creation
process. The result was volumes with invalid content being successfuly
created.

With the patch, an ImageDownloadFailed exception is raised in this case,
which makes the volume creation process fail and gives enough
information to operators for troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ic011fe30b4840e5098db1a594ea276ec98768bff
Closes-Bug: #1799221
(cherry picked from commit 864c074ff15db601c896dadc2842ae703861c0dd)
'}]
commit_message:
cinder-volume: Stop masking IOError different than ENOSPC

When glanceclient raises an IOError with a different errno than ENOSPC,
cinder-volume silently masked it and continued its volume creation
process. The result was volumes with invalid content being successfuly
created.

With the patch, an ImageDownloadFailed exception is raised in this case,
which makes the volume creation process fail and gives enough
information to operators for troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ic011fe30b4840e5098db1a594ea276ec98768bff
Closes-Bug: #1799221
(cherry picked from commit 864c074ff15db601c896dadc2842ae703861c0dd)

commit_message:
Workaround notification topic filling with OpenStack

OpenStack charms currently unconditionally enable notifications
for consumption by aodh/ceilometer etc...  If these services are
not deployed, then notification queues will fill over time and
cause alerts/service issues.

Workaround this issue for now by setting a TTL on notification
topics under the openstack vhost (if configured).

By default, the TTL for messages in any notification topics will
be set to 1 hour, after which they are dropped from the queue.

Change-Id: I46a11e98a2e3bbb6016e7ddfe27bdffe55c37aab
Partial-Bug: 1737170

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 17:02:09.000000000', 'message': 'Ironic dnsmasq should not use VIP for TFTP server

The ironic_dnsmasq config for ironic inspector uses the internal VIP for
the TFTP server address DHCP option. This is not going to work,
since HAProxy is not configured to forward TFTP, and does not support
UDP forwarding anyway. The config should use the api_interface IP for
the host running ironic_dnsmasq.

Change-Id: I56a0d46e9b528041cacea7196a525891ed5922f0
Closes-Bug: #1761815
(cherry picked from commit 2b3de16f815ac145a0a9bb2af92b4a60c6423251)
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic dnsmasq should not use VIP for TFTP server

The ironic_dnsmasq config for ironic inspector uses the internal VIP for
the TFTP server address DHCP option. This is not going to work,
since HAProxy is not configured to forward TFTP, and does not support
UDP forwarding anyway. The config should use the api_interface IP for
the host running ironic_dnsmasq.

Change-Id: I56a0d46e9b528041cacea7196a525891ed5922f0
Closes-Bug: #1761815
(cherry picked from commit 2b3de16f815ac145a0a9bb2af92b4a60c6423251)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Enable support for auto-converge and post-copy

Implement missing configuration options and context to support
configuration of:

  live_migration_permit_auto_converge
  live_migration_permit_post_copy

in nova.conf. The configuration parameters are only added to the
nova.conf template when live-migration is actually enabled, since they
have no purpose without live-migration enabled. The options are added to
version Newton and upwards as that is the Nova version since they were
first supported.

Change-Id: I1bb3cee4ac532d0867b4297c742707668566a527
Closes-Bug: #1799916

commit_message:
Move role data in share/ansible/roles

In order to consume os_tempest role in TripleO CI, the ansible
tries to looks for role in /usr/share/ansible/roles otherwise it
does not detect. Moving the roles data under data_files solves the
issue.

Change-Id: Id4a2adb926b0174c2b2ba6eaaadb8880b83e84af

commit_message:
Better tempest blacklist management

This patch set the information regarding how the tempest_test_blacklist
variable should be configured. From now, each test in the blacklist
should have a launchpad and/or bugzilla tighted on it in order to
trackdown the progress of the test, as well as use other tools to
automate the verification of the status of those bugs.

Change-Id: I36c41d97ca778d892c1655731cca9ac0112851c1

commit_message:
Allow to specify a non-default interpreter for the reproducer script

Now there is no possibility to set a python interpreter different
from the system one, when we create a virtual environment with the
reproducer script. But sometimes it can be convenient, especially
when system interpreter is python3, but we are going to test
deployment with python2.

This commit adds a new option -p|--python to the reproducer script,
that allows to set non-default python interpreter for the new virtual
environment.

Change-Id: I2d7923a39c00150bf7e43f8df4e889c8ecbb1f7a

commit_message:
Configure undercloud timezone

Add timezone service to the undercloud role so that it is properly
configured when we install the undercloud.

Change-Id: I4814cfb52f57d8260cda61adb6ac20609f435846
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628015/
Closes-Bug: #1784068

commit_message:
Adding ironic_dnsmasq_boot_file parameter to globals.yml

By now, ironic-dnsmasq has default bootfile pxelinux.0,
which is correct only for x86.
Adding ironic_dnsmasq_boot_file parameter to globals.yml
to make it configuable.
For example: /etc/kolla/globals.yml
ironic_dnsmasq_boot_file: "debian-installer/arm64/bootnetaa64.efi"

Change-Id: I6eb57702d4dad549ef8c999c1c82e577f316d8d6
(cherry picked from commit 4eaf39702339fbb6800806b6a06b0edbae41063b)

commit_message:
Fix grafana repo

Grafana repository is moved from packagecloud to
packages.grafana.com[0]. Based on new grafana install guide[1], update
the grafana.repo

[0] https://grafana.com/blog/2019/01/05/moving-to-packages.grafana.com/
[1] http://docs.grafana.org/installation/rpm/#install-via-yum-repository

Closes-Bug: #1810867
Change-Id: Ib065fdc561b72fc013b952b3df41ee83b083194e

[{'created': '2019-01-08 13:30:04.000000000', 'message': 'Do not dereference .stdout if dmidecode is missing

In 459b2664d99befa452e1946a4e4cf400183dd9e3 (Handle missing or bad
dmidecode) we accept return values of 0, 1 or 2 from command modules
that call 'dmidecode'.  However we then unconditionally look at the
stdout key in the result object.  When the dmidecode binary is missing
the result dictionary from the command module doesn't contain a stdout
key (resulting in something like):

---
fatal: [overcloud-novacomputeppc64le-1]: FAILED! => {"msg": "The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was: 'dict object' has no attribute 'stdout'\n\nThe error appears to have been in '/var/lib/mistral/overcloud/ceph-ansible/nodes_uuid_playbook.yml': line 14, column 7, but may\nbe elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.\n\nThe offending line appears to be:\n\n      failed_when: machine_uuid.rc not in [0, 1, 2]\n    - name: generate host vars from nodes data\n      ^ here\n"}
---

This change just adds a default('') filter to the lookup so a missing
key will fallback to an empty dictionary

Closes-Bug: 1790447
Change-Id: I7db180674c3696508a7f449e2e825e7083a00f6e
'}, {'created': '2019-01-08 13:59:09.000000000', 'message': 'Do not dereference .stdout if dmidecode is missing

that call 'dmidecode'.  However we then unconditionally look at the

key (resulting in something like):

---
fatal: [overcloud-novacomputeppc64le-1]: FAILED! => {"msg": "The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was: 'dict object' has no attribute 'stdout'\n\nThe error appears to have been in '/var/lib/mistral/overcloud/ceph-ansible/nodes_uuid_playbook.yml': line 14, column 7, but may\nbe elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.\n\nThe offending line appears to be:\n\n      failed_when: machine_uuid.rc not in [0, 1, 2]\n    - name: generate host vars from nodes data\n      ^ here\n"}
---

This change just adds a default('') filter to the lookup so a missing
key will fallback to an empty dictionary

Closes-Bug: 1790447
Change-Id: I7db180674c3696508a7f449e2e825e7083a00f6e
(cherry picked from commit f9b5401c1f478084031543d8c9f016068935596b)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not dereference .stdout if dmidecode is missing

In 459b2664d99befa452e1946a4e4cf400183dd9e3 (Handle missing or bad
dmidecode) we accept return values of 0, 1 or 2 from command modules
that call 'dmidecode'.  However we then unconditionally look at the
stdout key in the result object.  When the dmidecode binary is missing
the result dictionary from the command module doesn't contain a stdout
key (resulting in something like):

---
fatal: [overcloud-novacomputeppc64le-1]: FAILED! => {"msg": "The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was: 'dict object' has no attribute 'stdout'\n\nThe error appears to have been in '/var/lib/mistral/overcloud/ceph-ansible/nodes_uuid_playbook.yml': line 14, column 7, but may\nbe elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.\n\nThe offending line appears to be:\n\n      failed_when: machine_uuid.rc not in [0, 1, 2]\n    - name: generate host vars from nodes data\n      ^ here\n"}
---

This change just adds a default('') filter to the lookup so a missing
key will fallback to an empty dictionary

Closes-Bug: 1790447
Change-Id: I7db180674c3696508a7f449e2e825e7083a00f6e
(cherry picked from commit f9b5401c1f478084031543d8c9f016068935596b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 09:10:01.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated "decodestring()" by "decodebytes()"

decodestring() is deprecated alias of decodebytes()
https://docs.python.org/3/library/base64.html#base64.decodestring

The same has been done for nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610401/

Change-Id: If28dc7b9310b55e4d63ef7b2cdedbbdc944c9191
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated "decodestring()" by "decodebytes()"

decodestring() is deprecated alias of decodebytes()
https://docs.python.org/3/library/base64.html#base64.decodestring

The same has been done for nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610401/

Change-Id: If28dc7b9310b55e4d63ef7b2cdedbbdc944c9191

commit_message:
host_routes using get_attr (Composable Networks)

Uses get_attr on the port resource to resolve attribute
value from neutron subnet 'host_routes' attribute and
pass it to the parameter '{{network.name}}InterfaceRoutes'
in network configuration templates.

A conditional is used in puppet/role.role.j2.yaml. The
user provided parameter value is used whenever it is
not the default: []. This allow advanced user's to
override the routes in neutron.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>
Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: Ie44b211c4aeab9ca79d7994f31961e34aa3517e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 16:44:43.000000000', 'message': 'Handle string status codes in logging

Observed on "too many database connections" the following error in the
log:

Error formatting log line msg=u'*(url)s returned with HTTP *(status)d'
    err=TypeError('*d format: a number is required, not str',)

This was due to the format string using %d where somehow the result code
was actually a string. Since formatting numbers works with %s, and is
actually sometimes more performant, this just switches %d to %s to be
more flexible.

Change-Id: I52d6fb46c5ab0f2fa24c629697daaf39d35584c3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Handle string status codes in logging

Observed on "too many database connections" the following error in the
log:

Error formatting log line msg=u'*(url)s returned with HTTP *(status)d'
    err=TypeError('*d format: a number is required, not str',)

This was due to the format string using %d where somehow the result code
was actually a string. Since formatting numbers works with %s, and is
actually sometimes more performant, this just switches %d to %s to be
more flexible.

Change-Id: I52d6fb46c5ab0f2fa24c629697daaf39d35584c3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 04:41:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add tasks to remove legacy files

The change removes legacy files which conflict with new services being
deployed during a rolling upgrade. This change adds two tasks to remove
any legacy files should they be found.

Change-Id: Ie593a80e0e6708c50f7809171fa47c7043a2e136
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-01-04 20:44:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add tasks to remove legacy files

The change removes legacy files which conflict with new services being
deployed during a rolling upgrade. This change adds two tasks to remove
any legacy files should they be found.

Change-Id: Ie593a80e0e6708c50f7809171fa47c7043a2e136
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-01-04 20:53:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add tasks to remove legacy files

The change removes legacy files which conflict with new services being
deployed during a rolling upgrade. This change adds two tasks to remove
any legacy files should they be found and removes old cleanup handlers
that are no longer in service.

Change-Id: Ie593a80e0e6708c50f7809171fa47c7043a2e136
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add tasks to remove legacy files

The change removes legacy files which conflict with new services being
deployed during a rolling upgrade. This change adds two tasks to remove
any legacy files should they be found and removes old cleanup handlers
that are no longer in service.

Change-Id: Ie593a80e0e6708c50f7809171fa47c7043a2e136
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
debian/ubuntu: make use of Python3 based packages

Both Ubuntu Stein UCA and Debian 'buster' migrated their OpenStack
packages to Python 3.

Note that Debian 'buster' is not released yet and contains Rocky
packages. Stein ones will be available later.

Co-Authored-By: Eduardo Gonzalez <dabarren@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5a2a80898c4c967c747f57b7e38985af6a52d251

commit_message:
Support getting execution by id with specific list of fields

Sometimes it is redundant to load all execution's information,
e.g. when we need to check only one field periodically.
The new parameter `fields` at /v2/executions/{id} solves this problem.

Change-Id: I4488760afa4c3b8d563166b3e44147552d6c5ffc
Implements: blueprint mistral-getting-execution-with-specific-list-of-fields
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-05 22:24:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix section headers in docs home page

Because the title of the main home page was the
same as the sub-sections, the sub-sections were
not actually rendered which made a cluttered mess
of the docs.

This fixes the sub-section header formatting so the
sections are actually rendered properly.

Change-Id: I0377f85e334e5775f712b5a4fa238c76c436c2ae
'}]
commit_message:
Fix section headers in docs home page

Because the title of the main home page was the
same as the sub-sections, the sub-sections were
not actually rendered which made a cluttered mess
of the docs.

This fixes the sub-section header formatting so the
sections are actually rendered properly.

Change-Id: I0377f85e334e5775f712b5a4fa238c76c436c2ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 02:43:58.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia66a3bc2341f3468cbd7d327af0dd7fab07275d5
'}, {'created': '2018-11-26 07:10:24.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia66a3bc2341f3468cbd7d327af0dd7fab07275d5
Closes-Bug:  #1801657
'}, {'created': '2019-01-09 08:57:43.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that

Change-Id: Ia66a3bc2341f3468cbd7d327af0dd7fab07275d5
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia66a3bc2341f3468cbd7d327af0dd7fab07275d5
Closes-Bug:  #1801657
